[Navama Prabhrita] [ 71 Nor is it said that it is increasing or decreasing. 'P.
Ta Kaikatte Te Suriye Porisichhayam Nivvattei?' Ahie Tti Vaeeja. U. Tattha Imaao
Chhannauvi Padivattio Pannaattao, Tam Jaha - Tatthege Evmahamsu - 1. Ta Asthi
Nan Se Dese Jansi Nan Desansi Suriye Egaporisiyam Chhayam Nivvattei, Ege
Evmahamsu, Ege Pun Evmahamsu - 2. Ta Asthi Nan Se Dese Jansi Nan Desansi Suriye
Du-porisiyam Chhayam Nivvattei, Ege Evmahamsu, Evam Aeenam Abhilaavena Neyavvam,
Jaav (3-95) Ege Pun Evmahamsu - 96 - Ta Asthi Nan Se Dese Jansi Nan Desansi
Suriye Chhannauvi Porisiyam Chhayam Nivvattei, Ege Evmahamsu, Tattha Je Te
Evmahamsu - 1. Ta Atthi Nan Se Dese Jansi Nan Desansi Suriye Eg-porisiyam
Chhayam Nivvattei 'Tti' Te Evmahamsu, Ta Suriyass Nan Savvahetthimao Sur-
ppadhiho Bahitta Abhinisattaahi Leasaahi Tadijmaanihi Imisse Rayanppabhaae
Pudhaviye Bahusamaramanijao Bhumi Bhagao Jaavaiyam Suriye Uddham Uccatteena,
Evaiyaae Egaae Addaae, Egena Chhayanumaanappamaanaena Umaae, Tattha Se Suriye
Egaporisiyam Chhayam Nivvattei Tti, Tattha Je Ve Evmahamsu - 2. Ta Atthi Nan Se
Dese Jansi Nan Desansi Suriye Du-chorisiipam Chhayam Nivvattei 'Tti' Te
Evmahamsu, Ta Suriyass Nan Savvahetthimao Sur-ppadhiho Bahitta Abhinisattaahi
Leasaahi Tadijmaanihi Imisse Rayanppabhaae Pudhaviye Bahusamaramanijao Bhumi
Bhagao Jaavaiyam Suriye Uddhe Uccatteena, Evaiyaai Dohi Addaahi, Dohi
Chhayanumaanappamaanohi Umaae, Ettha Nan Se Suriye Daporisiyam Chhayam Nivvattei
Tti,  _ 3.95 - Evam Aeenam Abhilaavena Neyavvam, Jaav .... 1. After this, there
is no sentence here indicating 'Vayam Pun Evam Vayaamo' and there is no
statement of one's own opinion. Therefore, having heard the two interpretations
of the other sects, Bhagavan Gautama asks his own opinion, 'Ta Katthai
Kamitiyaadi' - Surya. Tika. The commentator's statement is not in accordance
with the compilation style of the Surya Prajnapti - because the statement of
one's own opinion is always presented after the statement of the interpretations
with the sentence 'Vayam Pan Evam Vayaamo'. 2. Tatra-teshan Shannavate: Among
the other sects, some say, 'Ta' as before, there is that country, in which
country the sun, having arrived, casts a shadow of one purusha-measure (purusha-
grahana is a euphemism for all visible objects, their own measure). - Surya.
Tika.

sUryaprajJapti kI saMkalanazailI ke anurUpa nahIM hai - kyoMki pratipattiyoM ke
kathana ke anantara 'vayaM paNa evaM vayAmo' isa vAkya se hI sarvatra svamata kA
pratipAdana kiyA gayA hai| 2. tatra-teSAM SaNNavate : paratIrthikAnAM madhye,
eke evamAhuH, 'tA' iti pUrvavat asti sa dezo, yasmin deze sUryaH Agata:san
ekapaurupI-ekapurupapramANAM (purupagrahaNamupalakSaNaM sarvasyApi
prakAzyavastunaH sva-pramANAM) chAyAM nirvrtyti| - sUrya. TIkA.

Page #123 (AI-GENERATED, RESEARCH USE ONLY):

72 1 There, those who said - 96. 'There are indeed countries, in those
countries, the sun sets after 60 *porisi* of shadow' - they said so, Then, the
sun, all the *hittimao* (rays) of the sun, having gone beyond the *surya-padhi*
(horizon), with the *abhinisadvahi* (rays) of the sun, with the *lesa* (rays) of
the sun, with the *tadijjamani* (rays) of the sun, with the *imise* (rays) of
the sun, with the *rayan-prabha* (rays) of the sun, on the earth, many
*samarmanijjao* (places) of the earth, as long as the sun rises high, in this
way, with the measure of 60 *porisi* of shadow, with the measure of *uma*
(time), here, the sun sets after 60 *porisi* of shadow, We, however, say this -
The sun sets after 60 *porisi* of shadow in the *sairag-aunattthi-porisi*. The
measure of *porisi-chhaya* (shadow of a *porisi*) Q. Then, is the shadow of a
*porisi* on a day, gone or remaining? A. It is gone or remaining in one part. Q.
Then, is the shadow of an *aunattthi-porisi* on a day, gone or remaining? A. It
is gone or remaining in 22,000 parts. Q. Then, is the shadow of a *porisi* on a
day, gone or remaining? A. It is gone or remaining in four parts. Q. Then, is
the shadow of a *divad-porisi* on a day, gone or remaining? A. It is gone or
remaining in five parts. Q. Then, is the shadow of a *bi-porisi* on a day, gone
or remaining? A. It is gone or remaining in six parts. Q. Then, is the shadow of
an *addhaijja-porisi* on a day, gone or remaining? A. It is gone or remaining in
seven parts. Q. A. Q. A. - Q. A. Q. A. [ Surya-prajnapti Sutra Q. A. 1.
Definition of *Paurushi* - 'A *purisa* (man), a *sanku* (rod), a *purisa-sarira*
(human body), from that *purisa*, a *porisi* is born, in this way, when the
shadow of any object is equal to its own measure, then it is called, \ This
measure of *porisi* is for one day at the end of *uttarayana* (northern
solstice), at the beginning of *dakshinayana* (southern solstice), after that,
in *dakshinayana*, it increases by 1/61 part of an *angula* (finger), in
*uttarayana*, it decreases, in this way, there are other *porisi* in the
*mandala* (circle). ' This definition of *paurushi* is quoted from the
commentary of *Surya-prajnapti* by Nandi-Churni. The language of Churni is
Sanskrit-mixed Prakrit, therefore, the above mentioned Churni text is not
incorrect.

## Ninth Chapter  [73]  And, leaving the half-pौरुषी, leaving the half-pौरुषी,
ask, leaving the day-part, leaving the day-part, the calculation, until... Q.
Then, the 67.5-pौरुषी, is the shadow gone or not? A. Then, it is gone or not in
1900 parts of the day. Q. Then, the 67.5-pौरुषी, is the shadow gone or not? A.
Then, it is gone or not in 22,000 parts of the day. Q. Then, the 67.5-pौरुषी, is
the shadow gone or not? A. Then, it is not gone or not in anything. There,
indeed, these 25 kinds of shadows are established, such as -  1. Pillar-shadow
2. Rope-shadow 3. Gate-shadow 4. Passage-shadow 5. Rising-shadow 6. Height-
shadow 7. Consequent-shadow 8. Antecedent-shadow 9. Beginning-shadow 10.
Following-shadow 11. Equal-shadow...  1. Thus, if, in this way, the
'half-pौरुषी' shadow, of the measure of half a man, is thrown, thrown, the
question, the question-thread, should be seen. - Surya. Commentary. 2. 'Day-
part', by increasing the day-part one by one, compared to the previous, previous
thread, the calculation, the answer-thread, should be known. - Surya.
Commentary. 3. Here, the question-answer marked here is corrected according to
the information of the brief reading given here. In the four copies of the
Surya-prajnapti, '1 A.S. | 2 Sha.S. | 3 A.Su. | 4 H.Gr.', how much are the
question-answers given there contrary to the information of the brief reading
given here? The reader should decide this himself. Q. 'Then, the 67.5-pौरुषी, is
the shadow gone or not? A. Then, it is gone or not in 1900 parts of the day. Q.
Then, the 67.5-pौरुषी, is the shadow gone or not? A. Then, it is gone or not in
22,000 parts of the day. Q. Then, the 67.5-pौरुषी, is the shadow gone or not? A.
Then, it is not gone or not in anything. (a) Here, it seems that there is a
reversal in these question-answers. First, there is the question-answer of the
67.5-pौरुषी shadow. The second question-answer is of the 67.5-pौरुषी shadow. The
third question-answer is of some more 67.5-pौरुषी shadow. (b) Here, the answer
is not in accordance with the questions. In the first question-answer - 'The
67.5-pौरुषी shadow is produced from 119 parts of the day' is assumed, but
according to the information of the brief reading text, it is produced from 120
days. In the second question-answer - the production of the 67.5-pौरुषी shadow
is from 22,000 parts of the day - is assumed, but this assumption is completely
irrelevant, because in the commentary of the information text of the brief
reading, there is only the indication of increasing one day-part by one. In the
third question-answer - the question itself is irrelevant, because in the
information text of the brief reading, if there is a question related to the
half-pौरुषी shadow, then the answer-thread said here is true.

## 74 [ Surya Prajnapti Sutra 12. Padihaya-chhaya 13. Khil-chhaya 14. Pakkha-
chhaya 15. Puro-udaya-chhaya 16. Purim Kanthabhag-uvagaya-chhaya 17. Pacchim-
kanth-bhag-uvagaya-chhaya 18. Chhaya-nuvaini-chhaya 19. Kittha-nuvaini-chhaya
20. Chhaya-chhaya 21. Vikkappa-chhaya 22. Vehas-chhaya 23. Kad-chhaya 24. Gol-
chhaya 25. Pitt-hodagga-chhaya. There are eight types of Gol-chhaya, as follows:
1. Gol-chhaya 2. Avaddha-gol-chhaya 3. Gadha-gol-chhaya 4. Avaddha-gadha-gol-
chhaya 5. Golvali-chhaya 6. Avaddha-golavali-chhaya 7. Gol-punj-chhaya 8.
Avaddha-gol-punj-chhaya. 1. This Sutra mentions twenty-five types of chhaya and
eight types of Gol-chhaya. Tatthetyadi, tatra = tasam panchavimshti-chhayana
madhye khalvayam gol-chhaya ashtavidha prajnapta. This statement from the
commentary of Surya Prajnapti suggests that there was a type of chhaya called
'Gol-chhaya' among the twenty-five types, and it had eight distinct types.
However, the three copies of Surya Prajnapti, '1 A.S. 2 Sha.S. 3 A.Su.', only
list seventeen names for chhaya and eight names for Gol-chhaya. This makes a
total of twenty-five names. The seventeen names do not include Gol-chhaya, yet
it is surprising to accept the twenty-five names as complete, aligning with the
'Tatthetyadi' text. One 'H.Gr.' copy lists twenty-five names for chhaya and
eight names for Gol-chhaya, which aligns with the original text. ]

## Dashama Prabhruta  [Prathama Prabhruta Prabhruta] The connection of the
Nakshatras with the Avaliya-Nivaaya is 32. P. So how are those connections with
the Avaliya-Nivaaya? It is said. U. There are five different opinions on this,
as follows: - There they said - 1. All the Nakshatras are connected with the
Katttiya-adiya Bharani-pajjavasaana, some said. Some others said - 2. All the
Nakshatras are connected with the Maha-adiya Asse-panj-avasaana, some said. Some
others said - 3. All the Nakshatras are connected with the Dhanittha-adiya
Savana-pajjavasaana, some said. Some others said - 4. All the Nakshatras are
connected with the Assini-adiya Revayi-pajjavasaana, some said. Some others said
- 5. All the Nakshatras are connected with the Bharani-adiya Assini-
pajjavasaana, some said. We, however, say -  All the Nakshatras are connected
with the Abhiyi-adiya Uttara-ashadha-pajjavasaana, as follows: - Abhiyi-Savani
until Uttara-ashadha. 1. In Jambudvipa, the island, there are 27 Nakshatras
connected with the Abhiyi-vajjeyi. - Sam. 27, Su. 2

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

32. pa. tA kahaM te joge ti vatthussa AvaliyA-NivAe ? Ahie tti vejaa| u. tattha
khalu imAo paMca paDivattIo paNNttAo, taMjahA - tatthege evamAhaMsu - 1. tA
savve vi NaM NakkhattA, kattiyAdiyA bharaNipajavasANA paNNattA, ege evmaahNsu|
ege puNa evamAhaMsu - 2. tA savve vi NaM NakkhattA, mahAdiyA assesa-panjavasANA

dhaNiTThAdiyA savaNapajjavasANA paNNattA, ege evmaahNsu| ege puNa evamAhaMsu -

## Dasham Prabhruta [Dvitiya Prabhruta Prabhruta]  **33. P. How many Muhurtas
are there for the conjunction of the Moon with the Nakshatras?**  **U. There are
28 Nakshatras.**  **[a]** There are some Nakshatras which are in conjunction
with the Moon for 9 Muhurtas, 27 Muhurtas, and 76 Muhurtas.  **[b]** There are
some Nakshatras which are in conjunction with the Moon for 15 Muhurtas.  **[c]**
There are some Nakshatras which are in conjunction with the Moon for 30
Muhurtas.  **[d]** There are some Nakshatras which are in conjunction with the
Moon for 45 Muhurtas.  **[a] P. So, out of these 28 Nakshatras, which Nakshatras
are in conjunction with the Moon for 9 Muhurtas, 27 Muhurtas, and 76 Muhurtas?**
**[b] Which Nakshatras are in conjunction with the Moon for 15 Muhurtas?**
**[c] Which Nakshatras are in conjunction with the Moon for 30 Muhurtas?**
**[d] Which Nakshatras are in conjunction with the Moon for 45 Muhurtas?**
**[a] U. Out of these 28 Nakshatras, the Nakshatras which are in conjunction
with the Moon for 9 Muhurtas, 27 Muhurtas, and 76 Muhurtas are only one,
Abhijit.**  **[b] Out of these 28 Nakshatras, the Nakshatras which are in
conjunction with the Moon for 15 Muhurtas are six, namely:**  - 1. Satabhisha,
2. Bharani, 3. Adda, 4. Aslesha, 5. Sati, 6. Jyeshta.  **[c] Out of these 28
Nakshatras, the Nakshatras which are in conjunction with the Moon for 30
Muhurtas are 15, namely:**  - 1. Savano, 2. Dhanishta, 3. Purvabhadrapada, 4.
Revati, 5. Ashwini, 6. Krittika, 7. Magha, 8. Pushya, 9. Maha, 10. Purva
Phalguni, 11. Hasta, 12. Chitra, 13. Anuradha, 14. Mula, 15. Purvashadha.  **[d]
Out of these 28 Nakshatras, the Nakshatra Abhijit is in conjunction with the
Moon for 9 Muhurtas.**  **9 Su. 5**

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

[ 77 Of the twenty-eight Nakshatras, there are six that are joined with the Moon
for 15 Muhurtas. They are: 1. Uttarabhadrapada, 2. Rohini, 3. Punarvasu, 4.
Uttaraphalguni, 5. Visakha, 6. Uttarashadha. _ Surya. Pa. 10, Pah. 2, Su. 33
Nakshatranam Surena Jogakalo 34. – There are twenty-eight Nakshatras, [a] some
of which are joined with the Sun for four days and six Muhurtas. [b] Some are
joined with the Sun for six days and twenty-one Muhurtas. [c] Some are joined
with the Sun for thirteen days and twelve Muhurtas. [d] Some are joined with the
Sun for twenty days and three Muhurtas. P. [a] Of the twenty-eight Nakshatras,
which ones are joined with the Sun for four days and six Muhurtas? [b] Of the
twenty-eight Nakshatras, which ones are joined with the Sun for six days and
twenty-one Muhurtas? [c] Of the twenty-eight Nakshatras, which ones are joined
with the Sun for thirteen days and twelve Muhurtas? [d] Of the twenty-eight
Nakshatras, which ones are joined with the Sun for twenty days and three
Muhurtas? U. [a] Of the twenty-eight Nakshatras, those that are joined with the
Sun for four days and six Muhurtas are one, namely Abhiyi. [b] Of the twenty-
eight Nakshatras, those that are joined with the Sun for six days and twenty-one
Muhurtas are six, namely: 1. Satabhisha, 2. Bharani, 3. Ashwini, 4. Aslesha, 5.
Shatabhisha, 6. Jyeshta. [c] Of the twenty-eight Nakshatras, those that are
joined with the Sun for thirteen days and twelve Muhurtas are fifteen, namely:
1. Savana, 2. Dhanishta, 3. Purvabhadrapada, 4. Revati, 5. Ashlesha, 6.
Krittika, 7. Magha, 8. Pushya, 9. Maha, 10. Purvaphalguni, 11. Hasta, 12.
Chitra, 13. Anuradha, 14. Mula, 15. Purvashadha. [d] Of the twenty-eight
Nakshatras, those that are joined with the Sun for twenty days and three
Muhurtas are six, namely: 1. Uttarabhadrapada, 2. Rohini, 3. Punarvasu, 4.
Uttaraphalguni, 5. Visakha, 6. Uttarashadha. ]

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

## From the tenth [third] Prabhruta [Prabhruta] onwards, the field-time measure
of the eastern parts of the Nakshatras is 35. P. How are these parts of the
Nakshatras? It is said, U. Thus it is, in the twenty-eight Nakshatras, [a] There
are Nakshatras with eastern parts, with a full field of thirty Muhurtas. [b]
There are Nakshatras with western parts, with a full field of thirty Muhurtas.
[c] There are Nakshatras with southern parts, with a reduced field of fifteen
Muhurtas. [d] There are Nakshatras with both parts, with an extended field of
forty-five Muhurtas. P. [a] Thus it is, in the twenty-eight Nakshatras, Which
Nakshatras have eastern parts, with a full field, of thirty Muhurtas? [b] Thus
it is, in the twenty-eight Nakshatras, Which Nakshatras have western parts, with
a full field, of thirty Muhurtas? [c] Thus it is, in the twenty-eight
Nakshatras, Which Nakshatras have southern parts, with a reduced field, of
fifteen Muhurtas? [d] Thus it is, in the twenty-eight Nakshatras, Which
Nakshatras have both parts, with an extended field, of forty-five Muhurtas? U.
[a] Thus it is, in the twenty-eight Nakshatras, There, those Nakshatras with
eastern parts, with a full field, of thirty Muhurtas, are six, namely - 1.
Purvaphalguni, 2. Krittika, 3. Maha, 4. Purvaphalguni, 5. Mula, 6. Purvashadha.
[b] Thus it is, in the twenty-eight Nakshatras, There, those Nakshatras with
western parts, with a full field, of thirty Muhurtas, are ten, namely - 1.
Abhijit, 2. Savana, 3. Dhanishtha, 4. Revati, 5. Ashvini, 6. Mrigashira, 7.
Pushya, 8. Hasta, 9. Chitra, 10. Anuradha. [c] Thus it is, in the twenty-eight
Nakshatras, There, those Nakshatras with southern parts, with a reduced field,
of fifteen Muhurtas, are six, namely - 1. Sayabhisha, 2. Bharani, 3. Adda, 4.
Ashlesha, 5. Satabhisha, 6. Jyeshta. [d] Thus it is, in the twenty-eight
Nakshatras, There, those Nakshatras with both parts, with an extended field, of
forty-five Muhurtas, are six, namely - 1. Uttaraphalguni, 2. Rohini, 3.
Punarvasu, 4. Uttaraphalguni, 5. Visakha, 6. Uttarashadha.

| Romanization (original text) |

## Dashama Prabhruta [Chaturtha Prabhruta Prabhruta] Nakshatranam Chande.
Jogaarambha Kaalo  36. P. Ta Kaham Te Jogass Aai? Ahie Ti Vaeeja, U. Ta Abhiyi-
Savana Khalu Duve Nakshatta, Pacchhabhaga Samakhitta', Saieregayegunachattalisai
Muhutta' Tappadhamaye Sayam Chanden Sadhim Joyam Joenti', Tao Pacchha Avaram
Sairegam Divasan. Evam Khalu Abhiyi-Savana Duve Nakshatta Egarain Egam Cha
Sairegam Divasan Chanden Sadhim Joyam Joenti, Joyam Jo Etta Joyam
Anupariyattati, Joyam Anupariyattita Sayam Chandam Dhanittaanam Sammati. 2. Ta
Dhanitta Khalu Nakshatte Pacchhambhage Samakkhette Tisaai-Muhutte Tappadhamaye
Sayam Chanden Sadhim Joyam Joeai, Tao Pacchharain Avaram Cha Divasan. Evam Khalu
Dhanitta Nakshatte Egam Cha Rai Egam Cha Divasan Chanden Sadhim Joyam Joeai,
Joyam Joetta Joyam Anupariyattai, Joyam Anupariyattitta Sayam Chandam
Sayabhisayanam Sampapei, 1. 'Iha Abhijinnaskhatram Na Samakshetram,
Napyapardhakshetram, Napi Dvayardhakshetram, Kevalam Shravananakshatrena Saha
Sambaddhamupattamittyabhedopacarat Tadapi Samakshetram Upkalpya
Samakshetramityuktam' 2. 'Saatireka Navamuhurtaah Abhijitt Trinshanmuhurtaah
Shravanasyetyubhayamilane Yathokatam Muhurtaparimanam Bhavati.' 3. 'Sayam-
Vikalavelayaam, Iha Divasasy Katitamatchaaramaad Bhagaadarabhya Yavadraatre
Katitamo Bhago Yavannadhaapi Parisphuta-Nakshatramandalalo Kastavan
Kaalaviseshah Sayamiti Vivakshito Drashtavyaah' 4. 'Ihaabhijinnaskhatram Yadyapi
Yugasyaadou Pratachaindrena Saha Yogamupaiti, Tathaapi Shravanena Saha
Sambaddhamiha Tadvikshita, Shravananakshatram Cha Madhyahaadurdhavam Apasarati
Divase Chandrena Saha Yogamupadatte, Tatastatsaacharyat Tadapi Sayam Samaye
Chandrena ''Sadhim Joyam Joenti' Ityuktam. Athava Yugasyaadimatirichaanyada
Bahulyamadhikrityedamuktam Tato Na Kaschiddoshah. - Teeka 5. 'Etaavantan Kalam
Yogam Yuktva Tadanantara Yogamanuparivartalate, Atmanachayaavayatityarthaah?' -
Suryaprajnapti Ki Teeka Se Udhrut. 6. 'Samakshetra Trinshanmuhurtam 'Chandra Ke
Saath Kisi Bhi Nakshatra Ka Yog, Yadi Tisa Muhurta Paryant Rahta Hai To Vah
'Samakshetra-Yog' Kaha Jata Hai.

 dazamaprAbhRta [caturtha prAbhRtaprAbhRta] NakkhattANaM cNde| jogAraMbhakAlo
36. pa. tA kahaM te jogAssa AI ? Ahie ti vaejA, u. tA abhiyI-savaNA khalu duve
NakkhattA, pacchAbhAgA samakhittA', sAiregaegUNacattAlisai muhuttA'
tappaDhamayAe sAyaM caMdeNa saddhiM joyaM joeMti', tao pacchA avaraM sAiregaM
divsN| evaM khalu abhiyI-savaNA duve NakkhattA egarAiM egaM ca sAiregaM divasaM
caMdeNa saddhiM joyaM joeMti, joyaM jo ettA joyaM aNupariyaTTati, joyaM

## 80 [ Surya Prajnapti Sutra ] 3.  The Sayabhisha Nakshatra, in the Avaddha
Kshetra (half field) of the Nakshatra Mandala, for fifteen Muhurtas, joins with
the Moon in the evening. It does not reach the next day. Thus, the Sayabhisha
Nakshatra, for one Rati, joins with the Moon in the evening. It joins, then it
continues to join, then it continues to join, and then in the evening, it
completes the joining with the Moon for the Purva-Pottva (first quarter).  4.
The Purva-Pottva Nakshatra, in the Purva Bhaga (first part) of the Sama Kshetra
(whole field), for thirty Muhurtas, joins with the Moon in the morning. Then, it
reaches the next Rati. Thus, the Purva-Pottva Nakshatra, for one day and one
Rati, joins with the Moon in the evening. It joins, then it continues to join,
then it continues to join, and then in the morning, it completes the joining
with the Moon for the Uttara-Pottva (second quarter).  The Uttara-Pottva
Nakshatra, in both parts of the Divaddha Kshetra (double field), for forty-five
Muhurtas, joins with the Moon in the morning. It reaches the next Rati, and then
it reaches the next day. Thus, the Uttara-Pottva Nakshatra, for two days and one
Rati, joins with the Moon in the evening. Then it continues to join, and then in
the evening, it completes the joining with the Moon for the Revati.  The Revati
Nakshatra, in the Pacchamma Bhaga (last part) of the Sama Kshetra (whole field),
for thirty Muhurtas, joins with the Moon in the evening. Then, it reaches the
next day. Thus, the Revati Nakshatra, for one Rati and one day, joins with the
Moon in the evening. It joins, then it continues to join, then it continues to
join, and then in the evening, it completes the joining with the Moon for the
Ashvini.  7. The Ashvini Nakshatra, in the Pacchamma Bhaga (last part) of the
Sama Kshetra (whole field), for thirty Muhurtas, joins with the Moon in the
evening. Then, it reaches the next day.  1. 'Apara-Kshetram Panchadasha
Muhurtam' - If the joining of any Nakshatra with the Moon lasts for fifteen
Muhurtas, it is called 'Apara-Kshetra-Yoga' or 'Half Field Yoga'. 2. 'Iha Purva-
Prosthapada-Nakshatra-sya Pratha-chandrena saha Prathamataya Yoga-pravritti
Itidam Purva-Bhagamucyate' - This is the Purva-Bhaga (first part) where the
Purva-Prosthapada Nakshatra joins with the Moon in the morning for the first
time. 3. 'Idam Kilottara-Bhadrapada-akhyam Nakshatramukta-prakarena Pratha-
chandrena saha-yogam adhigachchati. Kevalam Prathaman Panchadasha-muhurtan
adhikan-apaniya sama-kshetram kalpayitva yada yogaschintyate tada naktamapi
yogas-tityubhaya-bhagmavaseyam' - This is the Uttara-Bhadrapada Nakshatra, which
joins with the Moon in the morning in the same way as mentioned before. When the
joining is considered, keeping in mind only the first fifteen Muhurtas, and not
exceeding them, then the joining is also in the night. Thus, both parts should
be understood. 4. 'Uttara-Prakoṣṭha-pada-nakshatram khalu bhayabhagavyartha-
kshetram pancha-chatvarimśan-muhūrta, tat-prathamataya-yoga-prathamataya pratha-
chandrena sardha yogam yunakti, taccha, tatha yuktam sat tam sakalam api divasam
aparam cha ratrim tatas-pashchad aparam divasam yavad-vartate' - The Uttara-
Prakoṣṭha-pada Nakshatra, in both parts of the half field, for forty-five
Muhurtas, joins with the Moon in the morning for the first time. This joining,
thus joined, lasts for the whole day, then for the night, and then for the next
day, as long as it continues.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================
 80 ] [ sUryaprajJaptisUtra 3. tA sayabhisayA khalu Nakkhatte NattaMbhAge
avaDDakhette paNNarasa-muhutte, tappaDhamayAe sAyaM caMdeNa saddhiM joyaM joei,
no labhai avaraM divasaM, evaM khalu sayabhisayA Nakkhatte, egaM rAiM ca caMdeNa
saddhiM joyaM joei, joyaM joettA joyaM aNupariyaTTai, joyaM aNupariyaTTittA
sAyaM caMdaM puvvapoTThavayANaM samappei, 4. tA puvvA-poTuvayA khalu Nakkhatte
puvvaM bhAge' samakkhette tIsai-muhutte tappaDhamayAe pAo caMdeNa saddhiM joyaM
joei, tao pacchA avaraM rAI, evaM khalu puvvA-poTTavayA Nakkhatte egaM ca
divasaM egaM ca rAiM caMdeNa saddhiM joyaM joei, joyaM joettA aNupariyaTTai,
joyaM aNupariyaTTittA pAo caMdaM uttarApoTThavvayANaM samappei, tA
uttarApoTuvvayA khalu Nakkhatte ubhayaM bhAge divaDDakhette paNayAlIsa-muhutte ,
tappaDhamayAe pAo caMdeNa saddhiM joyaM joei, avaraM ca rAI tao pacchA avaraM ca
divsN| evaM khalu uttarApoTThavayA Nakkhatte do divase egaM ca rAI caMdeNa
saddhiM joyaM joei, joyaM aNupariyaTTittA sAyaM caMdaM revaINaM samappei,
tArevaI khalu Nakkhatte pacchaMbhAge samakkhette tIsai-muhutte tappaDhamayAe
sAyaM caMdeNa saddhiM joyaM joei, tao pacchA avaraM divasa, evaM khalu revaI
Nakkhatte egaM ca rAI, egaM ca divasaM caMdeNa saddhiM joyaM joei, joyaM joettA
joyaM aNupariyaTTai, joyaM aNupariyaTTittA sAyaM caMdaM assiNINaM samappei, 7.
tA assiNI khalu Nakkhatte pacchaMbhAge samakkhette tIsai-muhutte tappaDhamayAe
sAyaM caMdeNa saddhiM joyaM joei, tao pacchA avaraM divasaM, 1. 'apArdha-kSetraM
paMcadazamuhUrtam ' candra ke sAtha kisI bhI nakSatra kA yoga, yadi pandraha
muhUrta paryanta rahatA hai, to vaha 'apArdhakSetra-yoga' arthAt 'AdhA kSetra
yoga' kahA jAtA hai| 2. 'iha pUrvaproSThapapadAnakSatra sya prAtazcandreNa saha
prathamatayA yogaH pravRtta itIdaM puurvbhaagmucyte|' 3. 'idaM
kilottarAbhadrapadAkhyaM nakSatramuktaprakAreNa prAtazcandreNa
sahayogamadhigacchati  /  kevalaM prathamAn paMcadaza-muhUrtAn adhikAnapanIya
samakSetraM kalpayitvA yadA yogazcintyate tadA naktamapi
yogo'stItyubhayabhAgamavaseyam  /  4. 'uttaraprakoSThapadAnakSatraM
khalubhayabhAgaM vyardhakSetraM paMcacatvAriMzanmuhUrta, tatprathamatayA-
yogaprathamatayA prAtazcandreNa sArda yogaM yunakti, tacca, tathAyuktaM sat taM
sakalamapi divasamaparaM ca rAtriM tataH pazcAdaparaM divasaM yAvadvartate  /

## From the tenth (Dasham) onwards - ## From the fourth (Chaturth) onwards
Thus, in this Pakkhatta, one night and one day, the moon joins with the
constellation Bharani. After joining with it, the moon leaves Bharani in the
evening.  8. Now, in the Bharani constellation, in the night portion, in the
Avaddha Kshetra, in the 15th Muhurta, in the Tappadhama, the moon joins with
Bharani in the evening. It does not reach another day. Thus, in the Bharani
constellation, one night, the moon joins with it. After joining, the moon leaves
Bharani. After leaving Bharani, the moon joins with the constellation Kattinya
in the evening.  9. Now, in the Kattinya constellation, in the Purva Bhaga, in
the Sama Kshetra, in the 30th Muhurta, in the Tappadhama, the moon joins with
Kattinya in the evening. Then, after one night, Thus, in the Kattinya
constellation, one day and one night, the moon joins with it. After joining, the
moon leaves Kattinya. After leaving Kattinya, the moon joins with the
constellation Rohini in the evening.  1. 'By changing the Yoga, the moon leaves
the constellation in the evening, at the time when the constellation's light is
clear, and joins with Bharani. This Bharani constellation, according to the
rules, joins with the moon in the night. Therefore, the night portion should be
understood.'  2. Further, in the original text, the 'Sanshipta Vachana' is as
follows: - 'Rohini is like Uttarabhadrapada', 10. 11. Magasira is like
Dhanishta, 12. Adda is like Satabhisha, 13. Punarvasu is like Uttarabhadrapada,
14. Pushya is like Dhanishta, 15. Aslesha is like Satabhisha, 16. Maha is like
Purva Phalguni, 17. Purva Phalguni is like Purva Bhadrapada, 81 18. Uttara
Phalguni is like Purva Bhadrapada, 19-20. Hasta and Chitta are like Dhanishta,
21. Satti is like Satabhisha, 22. Visakha is like Uttarabhadrapada, 23. Anuradha
is like Dhanishta, 24. Jyeshta is like Satabhisha, 25. Mula is like Purva
Bhadrapada, 26. Purva Ashadha is like Purva Bhadrapada, 27. Uttara Ashadha is
like Uttara Bhadrapada.

## Surya Prajnapti Sutra (Chapter 10-15)  **10.** Now, in the Rohini Nakshatra,
in the eastern half of the sky, the moon joins with the sun for forty-five
Muhurtas, plus a fraction, and then there is a night, and then a day. Thus, in
the Rohini Nakshatra, the moon joins with the sun for two days and one night.
When the moon joins, it then moves on.  When it moves on, the moon sets in the
Mrigashira Nakshatra.  **11.** Now, in the Mrigashira Nakshatra, in the western
half of the sky, the moon joins with the sun for thirty Muhurtas, plus a
fraction, and then there is a night, and then a day. Thus, in the Mrigashira
Nakshatra, the moon joins with the sun for one night and one day.  When the moon
joins, it then moves on.  When it moves on, the moon sets in the Ardra
Nakshatra.  **12.** Now, in the Ardra Nakshatra, in the middle of the night, the
moon joins with the sun for fifteen Muhurtas, plus a fraction, and then there is
no day. Thus, in the Ardra Nakshatra, the moon joins with the sun for one night.
When the moon joins, it then moves on.  When it moves on, the moon sets in the
Punarvasu Nakshatra.  **13.** Now, in the Punarvasu Nakshatra, in the eastern
half of the sky, the moon joins with the sun for forty-five Muhurtas, plus a
fraction, and then there is a night, and then a day. Thus, in the Punarvasu
Nakshatra, the moon joins with the sun for two days and one night.  When the
moon joins, it then moves on.  When it moves on, the moon sets in the Pushya
Nakshatra.  **14.** Now, in the Pushya Nakshatra, in the western half of the
sky, the moon joins with the sun for thirty Muhurtas, plus a fraction, and then
there is a night, and then a day. Thus, in the Pushya Nakshatra, the moon joins
with the sun for one night and one day.  When the moon joins, it then moves on.
When it moves on, the moon sets in the Ashlesha Nakshatra.  **15.** Now, in the
Ashlesha Nakshatra, in the middle of the night, the moon joins with the sun for
fifteen Muhurtas, plus a fraction, and then there is no day.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

##  [Dasham Prabhrit - Chaturth Prabhrit Prabhrit] _83_  Thus, in the Asilesa
Nakshatra, the moon joins with one Rai, joins with it, then moves on from it,
and after moving on from it, gives the moon to Magha.  16. Now, in the Magha
Nakshatra, in the eastern part of the Samakshetra, for thirty Muhurtas, the moon
joins with one Rai, then after that, another Rai,  Thus, in the Magha Nakshatra,
the moon joins with one day and one Rai, joins with it, then moves on from it,
and after moving on from it, gives the moon to Purva Phalguni.  17. Now, in the
Purva Phalguni Nakshatra, in the eastern part of the Samakshetra, for thirty
Muhurtas, the moon joins with one Rai, then after that, another Rai,  Thus, in
the Purva Phalguni Nakshatra, the moon joins with one day and one Rai, joins
with it, then moves on from it, and after moving on from it, gives the moon to
Uttara Phalguni.  18. Now, in the Uttara Phalguni Nakshatra, in both parts of
the Diddhakhetra, for forty-nine Muhurtas, the moon joins with one Rai, then
after that, another Rai, and then another day,  Thus, in the Uttara Phalguni
Nakshatra, the moon joins with two days and one Rai, joins with it, then moves
on from it, and after moving on from it, gives the moon to Hasta in the evening.
19. Now, in the Hasta Nakshatra, in the western part of the Samakshetra, for
thirty Muhurtas, the moon joins with one Rai in the evening, then after that,
another Rai, and then another day,  Thus, in the Hasta Nakshatra, the moon joins
with one Rai and one day, joins with it, then moves on from it, and after moving
on from it, gives the moon to Chitra in the evening.  20. Now, in the Chitra
Nakshatra, in the western part of the Samakshetra, for thirty Muhurtas, the moon
joins with one Rai in the evening, then after that, another Rai, and then
another day,  Thus, in the Chitra Nakshatra, the moon joins with one Rai and one
day, joins with it, then moves on from it, ...

[84] When the Jo-yam is Anu-pariyattitta, it is given to the moon in the Sayam.
21. Then, in the Sayam, the moon joins the Jo-yam in the Nakshatra of Sai, in
the Natt-ambaga, in the Avaddha-kheta, in the 15th Muhurta, in the Tappadhama-
maya. It does not get another day. Thus, in the Nakshatra of Sai, the moon joins
the Jo-yam for one Rai. The Jo-yam is added, the Jo-yam is Anu-pariyattitta.
[Surya-prajnapti-sutra When the Jo-yam is Anu-pariyattitta, it is given to the
moon in the Visakha. 22. Then, in the Visakha, the moon joins the Jo-yam in the
Ubha-bhag, in the Divaddha-kheta, in the 42nd Muhurta, in the Tappadhama-maya.
It gets another Rai, and then another day. Thus, in the Nakshatra of Visakha,
the moon joins the Jo-yam for two days and one Rai. The Jo-yam is added, the Jo-
yam is Anu-pariyattitta. When the Jo-yam is Anu-pariyattitta, it is given to the
moon in the Anuradha. 23. Then, in the Anuradha, the moon joins the Jo-yam in
the Pachchha-bhag, in the Sama-kheta, in the 30th Muhurta, in the Tappadhama-
maya. It gets another Rai, and then another day. Thus, in the Nakshatra of
Anuradha, the moon joins the Jo-yam for one Rai and one day. The Jo-yam is
added, the Jo-yam is Anu-pariyattitta. When the Jo-yam is Anu-pariyattitta, it
is given to the moon in the Jyeshta. 24. Then, in the Jyeshta, the moon joins
the Jo-yam in the Natt-ambaga, in the Avaddha-kheta, in the 15th Muhurta, in the
Tappadhama-maya. It does not get another day. Thus, in the Nakshatra of Jyeshta,
the moon joins the Jo-yam for one day. The Jo-yam is added, the Jo-yam is Anu-
pariyattitta. When the Jo-yam is Anu-pariyattitta, it is given to the moon in
the Mula. 25. Then, in the Mula, the moon joins the Jo-yam in the Puvva-bhag, in
the Sama-kheta, in the 30th Muhurta, in the Tappadhama-maya. It gets another
Rai, and then another day. Thus, in the Nakshatra of Mula, the moon joins the
Jo-yam for one day and one Rai. The Jo-yam is added, the Jo-yam is Anu-
pariyattitta. When the Jo-yam is Anu-pariyattitta, it is given to the moon in
the Purva-ashadha. 26. Then, in the Purva-ashadha, the moon joins the Jo-yam in
the Puvva-bhag, in the Sama-kheta, in the 30th Muhurta, in the Tappadhama-maya.

[From the tenth to the fourth *prābhṛta* ] He joins with the moon, then
afterwards with the *rātri*, Thus, the *puvvāsāḍhā* constellation joins with the
moon for one day and one *rātri*, Joining, joining, *aṇu-pariyatṭa*, [85 He who
has *aṇu-pariyatṭita* reaches the moon in *uttarāsāḍhā* at the end. 27. Now, in
the *uttarāsāḍhā* constellation, in both parts of the day and night, for forty-
two *muhūrta* in the *tappiḍhamaya*, he joins with the moon, then afterwards
with the *rātri*, then afterwards with the day, Thus, the *uttarāsāḍhā*
constellation joins with the moon for two days and one *rātri*, Joining,
joining, *aṇu-pariyatṭa*, He who has *aṇu-pariyatṭita* reaches the moon in
*abhijit* in the evening. 1. The text from *sūtrāṅka* 10 to 27 is quoted here
from the commentary on the *sūryaprajñapti*.

saddhiM joyaM joei, joyaM jor3attA joyaM aNupariyaTTA, [ 85 jo aNupariyaTTittA

## From the Tenth (Dasham) onwards [From the Fifth (Pancham) onwards] the number
of constellations (Nakshatra) in the families (Kula, Uvakula, Kulovakula) is 37.
How are these families (Kula, Uvakula, Kulovakula)? Here is the explanation.
There are twelve families (Kula), twelve sub-families (Uvakula), and four
combined families (Kulovakula). The twelve families (Kula) are:  1. Dhanishtha
Kula 2. Uttarabhadrapada Kula 3. Ashwini Kula 4. Krittika Kula 5. Mrigashira
Kula 6. Pushya Kula 7. Magha Kula 8. Uttara Phalguni Kula 9. Chitra Kula 10.
Visakha Kula 11. Mula Kula 12. Uttarashadha Kula  The twelve sub-families
(Uvakula) are:  1. Shravana Uvakula 2. Purvaphalguni Uvakula 3. Revati Uvakula
4. Bharani Uvakula 5. Rohini Uvakula 6. Punarvasu Uvakula 7. Ashlesha Uvakula 8.
Purva Phalguni Uvakula 9. Hasta Uvakula 10. Satabhisha Uvakula 11. Jyeshta
Uvakula 12. Purvashadha Uvakula  The four combined families (Kulovakula) are:
1. Abhijit Kulovakula 2. Satabhisha Kulovakula 3. Ashwini Kulovakula 4. Anuradha
Kulovakula  1. The question in the Surya Prajnapti is incomplete, therefore, the
words "Uvakula, Kulovakula" have been added in brackets to complete it. In the
Jambudvipa Prajnapti, Vakh. 7, Sutra 161, the question is as follows:  > Q. How
many, O Venerable One, are the families (Kula)? How many are the sub-families
(Uvakula)? How many are the combined families (Kulovakula)? > A. Gotama! There
are twelve families (Kula), twelve sub-families (Uvakula), and four combined
families (Kulovakula).  The rest of the text is similar to the Surya Prajnapti,
but in this question-answer Sutra of the Jambudvipa Prajnapti, after the names
of the twelve constellations (Nakshatra), there is a verse indicating the
characteristics of the Kula, etc., which is also quoted in the commentary of the
Surya Prajnapti, and this verse is quoted in the present collection. If the
compiler of the Jambudvipa Prajnapti had given this verse at the beginning or
end of the present Sutra, it would have been more appropriate.  **Verse:**  >
The durations of the months are the families (Kula), the sub-families (Uvakula)
are below them. > The combined families (Kulovakula) are Abhijit, Satabhisha,
Ashwini, and Anuradha.  - Jambudvipa Prajnapti, Vakh. 7, Sutra 161  > "What are
the characteristics of the Kula, etc.? It is said: The durations of the months -
the completions of the months - are the families (Kula). What is the meaning
here? The constellations by which the completions of the months are usually
brought about, and which are named after the months, are known as families
(Kula)."  > "The constellations below the families (Kula), starting with
Shravana, are the sub-families (Uvakula). The constellations that are near the
families (Kula) are the sub-families (Uvakula) by courtesy."  > "Those that are
below the families (Kula) and the sub-families (Uvakula) are the combined
families (Kulovakula)."  - Jambudvipa Prajnapti, Commentary.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================
 dazamaprAbhRta [paMcama prAbhRtaprAbhRta] NakkhattANaM kulovakulAI - 37. tA
kahaM te kulA ( uvakulA, kulovakulA)? Ahie ti vejjaa| tattha khalu ime bArasa
kulA, bArasa uvakulA, cattAri kulovakulA pnnnnttaa| bArasakulA paNNattA taM jahA
- 1. dhaNiTThA kulaM 2. uttarAbhaddavayA kulaM 3. assiNI kulaM 4. kattiyAkulaM
5. migasirakulaM 6. pussakulaM 7. mahAkulaM 8. uttarAphagguNI kulaM 9.

[ 87 In twelve full moon nights, the number of Nakshatra conjunctions is 38. P.
So, how are those full moon nights? Tell me. U. There are twelve full moon
nights and twelve new moon nights, as follows: 1. Savitthi, 2. Potthavai, 3.
Asoya, 4. Kattia, 5. Maggasirri, 6. Posi, 7. Mahi, 8. Phagguni, 9. Cheti, 10.
Visaihi, 11. Jetthamoli, 12. Asadhi. 1. P. So, how many Nakshatras are
associated with the Savitthi full moon? U. Three Nakshatras are associated with
it, as follows: 1. Abhi, 2. Savano, 3. Dhanitta. 2. P. So, how many Nakshatras
are associated with the Potthavai full moon? U. Three Nakshatras are associated
with it, as follows: 1. Satabhisaya, 2. Puvva Potthavaya, 3. Uttara Potthavaya.
3. P. So, how many Nakshatras are associated with the Asoya full moon? U. Two
Nakshatras are associated with it, as follows: 1. Revati, 2. Assini. 4. P. So,
how many Nakshatras are associated with the Kattia full moon? U. Two Nakshatras
are associated with it, as follows: 1. Bharani, 2. Kattia. 5. P. So, how many
Nakshatras are associated with the Maggasirri full moon? U. Two Nakshatras are
associated with it, as follows: 1. Rohini, 2. Maggasirro. 6. P. So, how many
Nakshatras are associated with the Posi full moon? U. Three Nakshatras are
associated with it, as follows: 1. Adda, 2. Punavvasu, 3. Pusso. 7. P. So, how
many Nakshatras are associated with the Mahi full moon? U. Two Nakshatras are
associated with it, as follows: 1. Assesa, 2. Maha. 8. P. So, how many
Nakshatras are associated with the Phagguni full moon? U. Two Nakshatras are
associated with it, as follows: 1. Puvva Phagguni, 2. Uttara Phagguni. 9. P. So,
how many Nakshatras are associated with the Chitti full moon? U. Two Nakshatras
are associated with it, as follows: 1. Hattho, 2. Chitta. 10. P. So, how many
Nakshatras are associated with the Visaihi full moon? U. Two Nakshatras are
associated with it, as follows: 1. Sati, 2. Visaiha. 11. P. So, how many
Nakshatras are associated with the Jettha-muli full moon? U. Three Nakshatras
are associated with it, as follows: 1. Anuraha, 2. Jettha, 3. Mulo. 12. P. So,
how many Nakshatras are associated with the Asadhi full moon? U. Two Nakshatras
are associated with it, as follows: 1. Puvva Asadha, 2. Uttara Asadha. ]

## Tenth Prabhruta [Sixth Prabhruta Prabhruta]  **Twelve Full Moons, Kula-
Nakshatra-Yoga Combinations**  **39.**  **1.** **Q.** On the Savitthini Full
Moon, which Kula is joined, which Uvakula is joined, which Kulovakula is joined?
**A.** The Kula is joined, or the Uvakula is joined, or the Kulovakula is
joined.  **1.** When the Kula is joined, the Dhanishtha Nakshatra is joined.
**2.**   **3.**   **-**  **2.** When the Uvakula is joined, the Savana Nakshatra
is joined.  **3.** When the Kulovakula is joined, the Abhijit Nakshatra is
joined.  On the Savitthini Full Moon, whether the Kula is joined, or the Uvakula
is joined, or the Kulovakula is joined, it should be said that the Savitthini
Full Moon is joined with the Kula, or the Uvakula, or the Kulovakula.  **Q.** On
the Potthavini Full Moon, which Kula is joined, which Uvakula is joined, which
Kulovakula is joined?  **A.** The Kula is joined, or the Uvakula is joined, or
the Kulovakula is joined.  **1.** When the Kula is joined, the Uttara-Potthavaya
Nakshatra is joined.  **2.** When the Uvakula is joined, the Purva-Potthavaya
Nakshatra is joined.  **3.** When the Kulovakula is joined, the Satabhisha
Nakshatra is joined.  On the Potthavini Full Moon, whether the Kula is joined,
or the Uvakula is joined, or the Kulovakula is joined, it should be said that
the Potthavini Full Moon is joined with the Kula, or the Uvakula, or the
Kulovakula.  **Q.** On the Ashadhi Full Moon, which Kula is joined, which
Uvakula is joined, which Kulovakula is joined?  **A.** The Kula is joined, or
the Uvakula is joined, but the Kulovakula is not joined.  **1.** The remaining
sutra can be inferred as "Thus it should be considered," until it is said that
the Ashadhi Full Moon is joined. The Pausha Full Moon, the Jyeshta-Mooli Full
Moon, also joins the Kulovakula. In the remaining Full Moons, the Kulovakula is
not joined, so it should be considered and said.  **Suryatika**  -

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================
 dazamaprAbhRta [ chaThA prAbhRtaprAbhRta ] duvAlasAsu puNNamAsiNIsu kulAi -

uvakulaM joei, kulovakulaM joei ? u. tAkulaM vA joei, uvakulaM vA joei,

kulovakulaM vA joei, kuvA, uvakuleNa vA kalovakuleNa vA juttA sAviTThI puNNimA
juttAti vattavvaM siyA  /  pa. tA poTThavaiNNaM puNNamaM kiM kulaM joei,

## Dasham Prabhrit - Chatha Prabhrit Prabhrit  1. When the Kula is joined, it is
joined in the Ashwini Nakshatra. 2. When the Uvakula is joined, it is joined in
the Revati Nakshatra. If the Ashoina Purnima is joined with the Kula or the
Uvakula, it is to be said that the Ashoina Purnima is joined with the Kula or
the Uvakula. 4. Q. What is joined with the Kattika Purnima, the Kula, the
Uvakula, or the Kula Uvakula? A. The Kula or the Uvakula is joined, the Kula
Uvakula is not obtained. 1. When the Kula is joined, it is joined in the Kattika
Nakshatra. 2. When the Uvakula is joined, it is joined in the Bharani Nakshatra.
[89 If the Kattika Purnima is joined with the Kula or the Uvakula, it is to be
said that the Kattika Purnima is joined with the Kula or the Uvakula. Q. What is
joined with the Margashira Purnima, the Kula, the Uvakula, or the Kula Uvakula?
A. The Kula or the Uvakula is joined, the Kula Uvakula is not obtained. 1. When
the Kula is joined, it is joined in the Margashira Nakshatra. 2. When the
Uvakula is joined, it is joined in the Rohini Nakshatra. If the Margashira
Purnima is joined with the Kula or the Uvakula, it is to be said that the
Margashira Purnima is joined with the Kula or the Uvakula. 6. Q. What is joined
with the Pausha Purnima, the Kula, the Uvakula, or the Kula Uvakula? A. The
Kula, the Uvakula, or the Kula Uvakula is joined. 1. When the Kula is joined, it
is joined in the Pushya Nakshatra. 2. When the Uvakula is joined, it is joined
in the Punarvasu Nakshatra. 3. When the Kula Uvakula is joined, it is joined in
the Ashlesha Nakshatra. If the Pausha Purnima is joined with the Kula, the
Uvakula, or the Kula Uvakula, it is to be said that the Pausha Purnima is joined
with the Kula, the Uvakula, or the Kula Uvakula. Q. What is joined with the
Magha Purnima, the Kula, the Uvakula, or the Kula Uvakula? A. The Kula or the
Uvakula is joined, the Kula Uvakula is not obtained. 1. When the Kula is joined,
it is joined in the Magha Nakshatra. 7.

## 90 [ Surya Prajnapti Sutra 2. If a *Uvakula* is to be born, it is born in the
*Nakshatra* of *Jyestha*, if a *Kula* is to be born, it is born on the full moon
of the month, either by the *Kula* or by the *Uvakula*. If both *Kula* and
*Uvakula* are to be born, then it is to be said that both *Kula* and *Uvakula*
are born on the full moon of the month. 8. Q. On the full moon of *Phalguna*,
which is born, *Kula* or *Uvakula*, or both *Kula* and *Uvakula*? A. Either
*Kula* or *Uvakula* is born, both *Kula* and *Uvakula* are not born. 1. If
*Kula* is to be born, it is born in the *Nakshatra* of *Uttara Phalguni*, 2. If
*Uvakula* is to be born, it is born in the *Nakshatra* of *Purva Phalguni*, on
the full moon of *Phalguna*, either by the *Kula* or by the *Uvakula*. If both
*Kula* and *Uvakula* are to be born, then it is to be said that both *Kula* and
*Uvakula* are born on the full moon of *Phalguna*. 9. Q. On the full moon of
*Chaitra*, which is born, *Kula* or *Uvakula*, or both *Kula* and *Uvakula*? A.
Either *Kula* or *Uvakula* is born, both *Kula* and *Uvakula* are not born. 1.
If *Kula* is to be born, it is born in the *Nakshatra* of *Chitra*, 2. If
*Uvakula* is to be born, it is born in the *Nakshatra* of *Hasta*, on the full
moon of *Chaitra*, either by the *Kula* or by the *Uvakula*. If both *Kula* and
*Uvakula* are to be born, then it is to be said that both *Kula* and *Uvakula*
are born on the full moon of *Chaitra*. 10. Q. On the full moon of *Vaisakha*,
which is born, *Kula* or *Uvakula*, or both *Kula* and *Uvakula*? A. Either
*Kula* or *Uvakula* is born, both *Kula* and *Uvakula* are not born. 1. If
*Kula* is to be born, it is born in the *Nakshatra* of *Visakha*, 2. If
*Uvakula* is to be born, it is born in the *Nakshatra* of *Satabhisha*, on the
full moon of *Vaisakha*, either by the *Kula* or by the *Uvakula*. If both
*Kula* and *Uvakula* are to be born, then it is to be said that both *Kula* and
*Uvakula* are born on the full moon of *Vaisakha*. 11. Q. On the full moon of
*Jyestha-Mula*, which is born, *Kula* or *Uvakula*, or both *Kula* and
*Uvakula*? A. Either *Kula* or *Uvakula*, or both *Kula* and *Uvakula* are born.
1. If *Kula* is to be born, it is born in the *Nakshatra* of *Mula*, 2. If
*Uvakula* is to be born, it is born in the *Nakshatra* of *Jyestha*, 3. If both
*Kula* and *Uvakula* are to be born, it is born in the *Nakshatra* of
*Anuradha*. ]

| Romanization (original text) |

Page #142 (AI-GENERATED, RESEARCH USE ONLY):

[From the tenth to the sixth Prabhruta Prabhruta] It is so. 12. Q. On the full
moon of Ashadha, what lineage is obtained, what sub-lineage is obtained, what
lineage-sub-lineage is obtained? A. On the full moon of Ashadha, neither lineage
nor sub-lineage is obtained, 1. If lineage is obtained, it is obtained in the
Uttarashadha Nakshatra, 2. If sub-lineage is obtained, it is obtained in the
Purvashadha Nakshatra, On the full moon of Ashadha, neither lineage nor sub-
lineage is obtained, It should be said that the full moon of Ashadha is obtained
by lineage or sub-lineage. The number of Nakshatra combinations in the twelve
Amavasyas 1. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. Jyeshta - Mula - On the full moon, lineage or
sub-lineage or lineage-sub-lineage is obtained, it should be said that the full
moon of Jyeshta-Mula is obtained by lineage or sub-lineage or lineage-sub-
lineage. 8. Q. On the Amavasya of Savitthi, how many Nakshatras are obtained? A.
Two Nakshatras are obtained, namely - Aslesha and Magha, Q. On the Amavasya of
Potthavai, how many Nakshatras are obtained? A. Two Nakshatras are obtained,
namely - Purva Phalguni and Uttara Phalguni, Q. On the Amavasya of Asoi, how
many Nakshatras are obtained? A. Two Nakshatras are obtained, namely - Hasta and
Chitra, Q. On the Amavasya of Katti, how many Nakshatras are obtained? A. Two
Nakshatras are obtained, namely - Satabhisha and Visakha, Q. On the Amavasya of
Magha, how many Nakshatras are obtained? A. Three Nakshatras are obtained,
namely - Anuradha, Jyeshta and Mula, Q. On the Amavasya of Posi, how many
Nakshatras are obtained? 91 A. Two Nakshatras are obtained, namely - Purvashadha
and Uttarashadha, Q. On the Amavasya of Mahi, how many Nakshatras are obtained?
A. Three Nakshatras are obtained, namely - 1. Abhijit, 2. Savana, 3. Dhanishta,
Q. On the Amavasya of Phalguni, how many Nakshatras are obtained? A. Three
Nakshatras are obtained, namely - 1. Satabhisha, 2. Purva Potthavai.

## 92 [ Surya Prajnapti Sutra ]  9. P.  What constellations are associated with
the Amavasya (new moon) in the month of Cheti? U. Two constellations are
associated, namely, Tangiharevai and Assini.  10. P. What constellations are
associated with the Amavasya in the month of Visakha? U. Two constellations are
associated, namely, Bharani and Kattara.  11. P. What constellations are
associated with the Amavasya in the month of Jyestha-Muli? U. Two constellations
are associated, namely, Rohini and Magha.  12. P. What constellations are
associated with the Amavasya in the month of Ashadha? U. Three constellations
are associated, namely, 1. Adha, 2. Punavvasu, 3. Pushya.  In the twelve
Amavasyas, the number of constellations associated with the Kula (main
constellation) is:  1. P. What Kula (main constellation) is associated with the
Amavasya in the month of Savan? Does it have an Uvakula (sub-constellation) or a
Kulovakula (sub-sub-constellation)? U. It is associated with the Kula, but not
with the Uvakula or Kulovakula. 1. When associated with the Kula, the Maha
constellation is associated. 2. When associated with the Uvakula, the Asilesa
constellation is associated. Therefore, the Amavasya in the month of Savan is
associated with the Kula or the Uvakula. It should be said that it is associated
with the Kula or the Uvakula, depending on the constellation.  2. P. What Kula
(main constellation) is associated with the Amavasya in the month of Potthavai?
Does it have an Uvakula (sub-constellation) or a Kulovakula (sub-sub-
constellation)? U. It is associated with the Kula, but not with the Uvakula or
Kulovakula. 1. When associated with the Kula, the Uttara Phalguni constellation
is associated. 2. When associated with the Uvakula, the Purva Phalguni
constellation is associated. Therefore, the Amavasya in the month of Potthavai
is associated with the Kula or the Uvakula. It should be said that it is
associated with the Kula or the Uvakula, depending on the constellation.  3. P.
What Kula (main constellation) is associated with the Amavasya in the month of
Asoi? Does it have an Uvakula (sub-constellation) or a Kulovakula (sub-sub-
constellation)? U. It is associated with the Kula, but not with the Uvakula or
Kulovakula. 1. When associated with the Kula, the Chitra constellation is
associated. 2. When associated with the Uvakula, the Hasta constellation is
associated. Therefore, the Amavasya in the month of Asoi is associated with the
Kula or the Uvakula.

[From the tenth Prabhruta to the sixth Prabhruta Prabhruta] It should be said
that the one who is born on an Amavasya is either a Kula or an Uvakula. 4. Q. On
which Nakshatra is the Amavasya born? Is it a Kula, an Uvakula, or a Kulovakula?
A. It is either a Kula or an Uvakula, but not a Kulovakula. 1. If it is a Kula,
it is born on the Visakha Nakshatra. 2. If it is an Uvakula, it is born on the
Saayi Nakshatra. Therefore, the Amavasya is either a Kula or an Uvakula. It
should be said that the one who is born on an Amavasya is either a Kula or an
Uvakula. 5. Q. On which Nakshatra is the Magha Amavasya born? Is it a Kula, an
Uvakula, or a Kulovakula? A. It is either a Kula or an Uvakula, but not a
Kulovakula. 1. If it is a Kula, it is born on the Mula Nakshatra. 2. If it is an
Uvakula, it is born on the Jyeshta Nakshatra. 3. If it is a Kulovakula, it is
born on the Anuradha Nakshatra. Therefore, the Magha Amavasya is either a Kula,
an Uvakula, or a Kulovakula. It should be said that the one who is born on the
Magha Amavasya is either a Kula, an Uvakula, or a Kulovakula. 6. Q. On which
Nakshatra is the Posha Amavasya born? Is it a Kula, an Uvakula, or a Kulovakula?
A. It is either a Kula or an Uvakula, but not a Kulovakula. 1. If it is a Kula,
it is born on the Purvashadha Nakshatra. 2. If it is an Uvakula, it is born on
the Uttarashadha Nakshatra. Therefore, the Posha Amavasya is either a Kula or an
Uvakula. It should be said that the one who is born on the Posha Amavasya is
either a Kula or an Uvakula. 7. Q. On which Nakshatra is the Maaha Amavasya
born? Is it a Kula, an Uvakula, or a Kulovakula? A. It is either a Kula, an
Uvakula, or a Kulovakula. 1. If it is a Kula, it is born on the Abhijit
Nakshatra. 2. If it is an Uvakula, it is born on the Savana Nakshatra. 3. If it
is a Kulovakula, it is born on the Dhanishta Nakshatra.

[94] [Surya Prajnapti Sutra] If a person is born on an Amavasya (new moon) in a
Kula (family), or in an Uvakula (sub-family), or in a Kulovakula (combined
family), then it should be said that he is born in a Kula, or in an Uvakula, or
in a Kulovakula, respectively. 8. P. Now, on the Amavasya of the month of
Phalguna, in what Kula is a person born? In an Uvakula? In a Kulovakula? A. He
is born in a Kula, or in an Uvakula, but not in a Kulovakula. 1. If he is born
in a Kula, he is born in the Nakshatra Satabhisha. 2. If he is born in an
Uvakula, he is born in the Nakshatra Purvaphalguni. Therefore, on the Amavasya
of Phalguna, he is born in a Kula, or in an Uvakula, but not in a Kulovakula. 9.
P. Now, on the Amavasya of the month of Chaitra, in what Kula is a person born?
In an Uvakula? In a Kulovakula? A. He is born in a Kula, or in an Uvakula, and
also in a Kulovakula. 1. If he is born in a Kula, he is born in the Nakshatra
Revati. 2. If he is born in an Uvakula, he is born in the Nakshatra Ashwini.
Therefore, on the Amavasya of Chaitra, he is born in a Kula, or in an Uvakula,
and also in a Kulovakula. 10. P. Now, on the Amavasya of the month of Vaisakha,
in what Kula is a person born? In an Uvakula? In a Kulovakula? A. He is born in
a Kula, or in an Uvakula, but not in a Kulovakula. 1. If he is born in a Kula,
he is born in the Nakshatra Bharani. 2. If he is born in an Uvakula, he is born
in the Nakshatra Krittika. Therefore, on the Amavasya of Vaisakha, he is born in
a Kula, or in an Uvakula, but not in a Kulovakula. 11. P. Now, on the Amavasya
of the month of Jyeshtha, in what Kula is a person born? In an Uvakula? In a
Kulovakula? A. He is born in a Kula, or in an Uvakula, but not in a Kulovakula.
1. If he is born in a Kula, he is born in the Nakshatra Rohini. 2. If he is born
in an Uvakula, he is born in the Nakshatra Mrigashira. Therefore, on the
Amavasya of Jyeshtha, he is born in a Kula, or in an Uvakula, but not in a
Kulovakula.

[From the tenth Prabhruta to the sixth Prabhruta Prabhruta] [ 95 It should be
said that the Ashadha Amavasya is the Jutta of the Kula, or the Jutta of the
Uvakula, or the Jutta of the Kulovakula. 12.p. So, which Kula is the Ashadha
Amavasya, the Kula, the Uvakula, or the Kulovakula? A. The Kula, or the Uvakula,
or the Kulovakula. 1. If the Kula is the Jutta, then the Adha Nakshatra is the
Jutta. 2. If the Uvakula is the Jutta, then the Punavassu Nakshatra is the
Jutta. 3. If the Kulovakula is the Jutta, then the Pussa Nakshatra is the Jutta.
So, the Ashadha Amavasya is the Jutta of the Kula, or the Jutta of the Uvakula,
or the Jutta of the Kulovakula. It should be said that the Ashadha Amavasya is
the Jutta of the Kula, or the Jutta of the Uvakula, or the Jutta of the
Kulovakula. ]

[ख] From the tenth [seventh from the seventh] to the twelfth, on the full moons
and new moons, and also on the conjunction of the moon and the constellations -
40. 1. P. How are these days connected? Ans. [क] When the Savitthi full moon
occurs, then the Mahii new moon occurs. [ख] When the Mahii full moon occurs,
then the Savitthi new moon occurs. 2. [क] When the Putthavai full moon occurs,
then the Phagguni new moon occurs. When the Phagguni full moon occurs, then the
Putthavai new moon occurs. [क] When the Asoi full moon occurs, then the Chetti
new moon occurs. [ख] When the Chetti full moon occurs, then the Asoi new moon
occurs. [क] When the Kattiyai full moon occurs, then the Vesaihi new moon
occurs. [ख] When the Vesaihi full moon occurs, then the Kattiyai new moon
occurs. [क] When the Maggasir full moon occurs, then the Jetthamuuli new moon
occurs. [ख] When the Jetthamuuli full moon occurs, then the Maggasir new moon
occurs. [क] When the Posii full moon occurs, then the Asadhi new moon occurs.
[ख] When the Asadhi full moon occurs, then the Posii new moon occurs.

## The Arrangement of the Nakshatras  **41.**  **From the Tenth** [From the
Eighth, From the Eighth]  1. **Q.** How are these Nakshatras arranged? **A.**
They are arranged according to the twenty-eight Nakshatras.  2. **Q.** What is
the arrangement of the **Gosisavali** Nakshatra? **A.** It is arranged according
to the **Go** (cow) **Sisa** (head) **Aval** (row).  3. **Q.** What is the
arrangement of the **Savana** Nakshatra? **A.** It is arranged according to the
**Kahar** (eating) **Sant** (together).  4. **Q.** What is the arrangement of
the **Dhanishtha** Nakshatra? **A.** It is arranged according to the **Sau**
(hundred) **Ni** (not) **Pali** (row) **Na** (not) **Ga** (going).  5. **Q.**
What is the arrangement of the **Sayabhisha** Nakshatra? **A.** It is arranged
according to the **Puppha** (flower) **Ova** (above) **Yara** (going) **Sant**
(together).  6. **Q.** What is the arrangement of the **Puvva** (east) **A**
(and) **Potthava** (rising) Nakshatra? **A.** It is arranged according to the
**Avaddha** (not) **Vavi** (going) **Sant** (together).  7. **Q.** What is the
arrangement of the **Uttara** (north) **A** (and) **Potthava** (rising)
Nakshatra? **A.** It is arranged according to the **Avaddha** (not) **Vavi**
(going) **Sant** (together).  8. **Q.** What is the arrangement of the **Revai**
Nakshatra? **A.** It is arranged according to the **Nava** (new) **Sant**
(together).  9. **Q.** What is the arrangement of the **Assi** (eight) **Ni**
(not) Nakshatra? **A.** It is arranged according to the **Asakkh** (not)
**Andha** (blind) **Sant** (together).  10. **Q.** What is the arrangement of
the **Bharani** Nakshatra? **A.** It is arranged according to the **Bha**
(light) **Ga** (going) **Sant** (together).  11. **Q.** What is the arrangement
of the **Kattiya** Nakshatra? **A.** It is arranged according to the **Chur**
(knife) **Ghar** (house) **Ga** (going) **Sant** (together).

| Romanization (original text) |

##  Translation:  **[From the tenth onwards - from the eighth onwards]** **24.Q.
How is the Ashta Nakshatra (eighth constellation) formed?** **A. It is formed by
the Egaavali (single line) formation.** **25.Q. How is the Jyeshta Nakshatra
(tenth constellation) formed?** **A. It is formed by the Gayadanta (elephant
tusk) formation.** **26.Q. How is the Mula Nakshatra (twelfth constellation)
formed?** **A. It is formed by the Vichchhuyalangola (scorpion tail)
formation.** **27.Q. How is the Purvashadha Nakshatra (fourteenth constellation)
formed?** **A. It is formed by the Gayavikkama (elephant's gait) formation.**
**28.Q. How is the Uttarashadha Nakshatra (fifteenth constellation) formed?**
**A. It is formed by the Sihanisaiya (lion's roar) formation.**  **1.Q.
Venerable Sir! How is the remaining twenty-eight Nakshatras formed?** **A. Go!
They are formed by the Gosi Savali (cow's tail) formation.**  **Explanation:**
**1. Gosi Savali, 2. Kahar, 3. Sauni, 4. Puphovyar, 5-6. Vavi.** **7. Nava, 8.
Asakkhandhaga, 9. Bhaga, 10. Chhurgharaye, 11. Asangadudhi.** **12. Migsi
Savali, 13. Ruhirbindu, 14. Tula, 15. Baddhamanaga, 16. Padaga.** **17. Pagare,
18-19. Paliyanke, 20. Hatthe, 21. Muhphullae.** **22. Khilga, 23. Damani, 24.
Egaavali, 25. Gayadanta, 26. Vichchhuyalangule.** **27. Gayavikkama, 28.
Sihanisihi.**  **These verses are quoted in the commentary of Surya
Prajnaptti.**  **-**  **The formations of Purvabhadrapada - Uttarabhadrapada and
Purvafalguni - Uttarafalguni are considered similar, but the formations of
Purvashadha - Uttarashadha are considered different.**  **The reason for this
difference in formations is as follows:**  **Purvabhadrapada has an Ardhavaapi
(half-well) formation, and Uttarabhadrapada also has an Ardhavaapi formation.
These two Ardhavaapis combine to form a complete Vaapi (well), hence the term
Vaapi is used in the sutra.**  **Purvafalguni has an Ardhapalyanka (half-bed)
formation, and Uttarafalguni also has an Ardhapalyanka formation. Here too, the
two Ardhapalyanakas combine to form a complete Palyanka (bed), hence there is no
reduction in the number.**  **[Jambudvipa Vyakhyana 6, Sutra 160 Commentary]**

| Romanization (original text) |

## Dashama Prabhruta  [Navama Prabhruta Prabhruta]  The number of stars in the
constellations, Sutra 42-1. P. How many stars are there in those constellations?
U. How many stars are there in the Abhijit constellation? U. There are one star.
P. How many stars are there in the Savana constellation? U. There are one star.
P. How many stars are there in the Dhanishtha constellation? U. There are five
stars. P. How many stars are there in the Satabhisha constellation? U. There are
one hundred stars. 1. K-P. So, how many stars are there in the Abhijit
constellation? U. Go-yama! There are one star.  Thus, the number of stars in
each constellation is as follows:  1. Three, three, five, one hundred, two,
thirty-two, three, three, six, five, three, one, five, three, six. 2. Seven,
two, two, five, one, one, five, four, three. Eleven, four, four.  - Jambudvipa
Vyakhyana 6, Sutra 159: Abhijit constellation has one star, Savana has one,
Ashvini has one, Bharani has one, Magha has one, Purva Phalguni has one, Uttara
Phalguni has one, Hasta has one, Chitra has one, Swati has one, Visakha has one,
Anuradha has one, Jyeshta has one, Mula has one, Purva Ashadha has one, Uttara
Ashadha has one, Shravana has one, Dhanishtha has one, Shatabhisha has one,
Purva Bhadrapada has one, Uttara Bhadrapada has one, Revati has one. - Thananga
A. 3, U. 3, Sutra 227: Abhijit constellation has one star. - Samaya Sar 3, Sutra
9: Thananga A. 3, U. 3, Sutra 227 Samaya Sar 3, Sutra 9: K. Five constellations
have five stars each, namely: 1. Dhanishtha, 2. Rohini, 3. Punarvasu, 4. Hasta,
5. Visakha. - Thananga A. 5, U. 3, Sutra 473: Kh. Samaya Sar 5, Sutra 13: 4.
Satabhisha constellation has one hundred stars. - Samaya Sar 100, Sutra 2.

From the tenth (Dasham) onwards [from the tenth onwards] the season - Hemant
(winter) - has 43 days. 1. Tell me, how many constellations (Nakshatra) are
there in this season? Answer: There are four constellations in this season,
namely: 1. Uttarashadha, 2. Abhijit, 3. Sravana, 4. Dhanishtha. 1. Uttarashadha
stays for 14 days, 2. Abhijit stays for 7 days, 3. Sravana stays for 8 days, 4.
Dhanishtha stays for 1 day. In this month, the sun moves in the sky with a
shadow of four angulas (finger widths). On the last day of this month, the
shadow is two padas (feet) and four angulas. 2. Tell me, how many constellations
are there in the second month of this season? ... Answer: There are four
constellations in this month, namely: 1. Dhanishtha, 2. Satabhisha, 3.
Purvaphalguni, 4. Uttaraphalguni. 1. Dhanishtha stays for 14 days, 2. Satabhisha
stays for 7 days, 3. Purvaphalguni stays for 8 days, 4. Uttaraphalguni stays for
1 day. In this month, the sun moves in the sky with a shadow of eight angulas.
On the last day of this month, the shadow is two padas and eight angulas. 3.
Tell me, how many constellations are there in the third month of this season?
Answer: There are three constellations in this month, namely: 1. Uttaraphalguni,
2. Revati, 3. Ashwini. 1. Uttaraphalguni stays for 14 days,

moves in the shadow of sixteen angulas. On the last day of this month, the

[106] [Surya Prajnapti Sutra] 3. The Sun stays in one *Ahoratta* for one month,
and in that month, the Sun moves in the shadow of 20 *Angulas* in the *Porisi*.
On the last day of that month, it becomes 3 *Payais* and 8 *Angulas* in the
*Porisi*. P. 4. So, how many *Nakshatras* are there in the fourth month of
*Hemant*? A. There are 3 *Nakshatras*, namely: 1. *Magha*, 2. *Puvva Phalguni*,
3. *Uttara Phalguni*. 1. *Magha* stays for 14 *Ahorattas*, 2. *Puvva Phalguni*
stays for 15 *Ahorattas*, 3. *Uttara Phalguni* stays for 1 *Ahoratta*, and in
that month, the Sun moves in the shadow of 16 *Angulas* in the *Porisi*. On the
last day of that month, it becomes 3 *Payais* and 4 *Angulas* in the *Porisi*.
P. 1. So, how many *Nakshatras* are there in the first month of *Grihma*? A.
There are 3 *Nakshatras*, namely: 1. *Uttara Phalguni*, 2. *Hattha*, 3.
*Chitta*. 1. *Uttara Phalguni* stays for 14 *Ahorattas*, 2. *Hattha* stays for
15 *Ahorattas*, 3. *Chitta* stays for 1 *Ahoratta*, and in that month, the Sun
moves in the shadow of 12 *Angulas* in the *Porisi*. On the last day of that
month, it becomes *Lehatthai* and 3 *Payais* in the *Porisi*. P. 2. So, how many
*Nakshatras* are there in the second month of *Grihma*? A. There are 3
*Nakshatras*, namely: 1. *Chitta*, 2. *Sai*, 3. *Visaha*. 1. *Chitta* stays for
14 *Ahorattas*, 2. *Sai* stays for 15 *Ahorattas*, 3. *Visaha* stays for 1
*Ahoratta*, and in that month, the Sun moves in the shadow of 8 *Angulas* in the
*Porisi*. On the last day of that month, it becomes 2 *Payais* and 8 *Angulas*
in the *Porisi*. P. 3. So, how many *Nakshatras* are there in the third month of
*Grihma*? A. There are 3 *Nakshatras*, namely: 1. *Visaha*, 2. *Anuradha*, 3.
*Jyeshthamulo*. 1. *Visaha* stays for 14 *Ahorattas*, 2. *Anuradha* stays for 15
*Ahorattas*, 3. *Jyeshthamulo* stays for 1 *Ahoratta*,

## Chandamagga Nakshatra Jog Sankhya 44  **P.** **U.** **P.** **Dashama
Prabhruta [Gyarahava Prabhruta Prabhruta]**  **Q.** How are these Chandamaggas?
**A.** There are 28 Nakshatras:  1. Some Nakshatras are aligned with the Moon to
the South. 2. Some Nakshatras are aligned with the Moon to the North. 3. Some
Nakshatras are aligned with the Moon to both the South and North. 4. Some
Nakshatras are aligned with the Moon to the South and also to the West. 5. Some
Nakshatras are aligned with the Moon to the South and also to the East.  **Q.**
Out of these 28 Nakshatras:  1. Which Nakshatras are aligned with the Moon to
the South? 2. Which Nakshatras are aligned with the Moon to the North? 3. Which
Nakshatras are aligned with the Moon to both the South and North? 4. Which
Nakshatras are aligned with the Moon to the South and also to the West? 5. Which
Nakshatras are aligned with the Moon to the South and also to the East?  **A.**
1. Out of these 28 Nakshatras, there are 6 Nakshatras aligned with the Moon to
the South:      1. Santhana     2. Adha     3. Pusso     4. Asseesa     5.
Hattho     6. Mulo  2. Out of these 28 Nakshatras, there are 12 Nakshatras
aligned with the Moon to the North:      1. Abhii     2. Savano     3. Dhanittha
4. Satabhisaya     5. Puvva Bhadavaya     6. Uttara Bhadavaya     7. Revai
8. Assini     9. Bharani     10. Puvva Phalguni     11. Uttara Phalguni     12.
Sati  3. Out of these 28 Nakshatras, there are 7 Nakshatras aligned with the
Moon to both the South and North:      1. Kattiya     2. Rohini     3. Punavvasu
4. Maha     5. Chitta     6. Visakha     7. Anuradha

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================
 caMdamagge NakkhattajogasaMkhA 44 pa. u. pa. dazamaprAbhRta [ gyArahavA
prAbhRtaprAbhRta ] tA kahaM te caMdamaggA Ahie tti vaejjA ? tAsi NaM aTThAvIsAe
NakkhattANaM - 1. atthi NakkhattA jeNaM sayA caMdassa dAhiNeNaM jogaM joeMti, 2.
atthi NakkhattA je NaM sayA caMdassa uttareNaM jogaM joeMti, 3. atthi NakkhattA
je NaM caMdassa dAhiNeNa'vi uttareNa'vi jogaM joeMti, 4. atthi NakkhattA jeNaM
caMdassa dAhiNeNa'vi pamaddapi jogaM joeMti, 5. atthi NakkhattA je NaM caMdassa
sayA pamaddaM jogaM joeMti, tAeesi NaM aTThAvIsAe NakkhattANaM 1. kayare
NakkhattA je NaM sayA caMdassa dAhiNeNaM jogaM joeMti ? 2. kayare NakkhattA
jeNaM sayA caMdassa uttareNaM jogaM joeMti ? 3. kayare NakkhattA je NaM caMdassa
dAhiNeNa'vi uttareNa'vi jogaM joeMti ? 4. kayare NakkhattA je NaM sayA caMdassa
dAhiNeNa'vi pamaddaM jogaM joeMti ? 5. kayare NakkhattA je NaM caMdassa sayA
pamaddaM jogaM joeMti ? u. 1. tAeesi NaM aTThAvIsAe NakkhattANaM - tattha je NaM
NakkhattA sayA caMdassa dAhiNeNaM jogaM joeMti, te NaM cha, taMjahA 1. saMThANA,
2. addhA, 3. pusso, 4. assesA, 5. hattho, 6. mUlo, 2. tattha je te NakkhattA je
NaM sayA caMdassa uttareNaM jogaM joeMti, te NaM bArasa, taMjahA - 1. abhiI, 2.
savaNo, 3. dhaNiTThA, 4. satabhisayA, 5. puvvabhaddavayA, 6. uttarabhaddavayA,
7. revaI, 8. assiNI, 9. bharaNI, 10. puvvaphagguNI, 11. uttaraphagguNI, 12.
sAtI, 3. tattha je te NakkhattA je NaM caMdassa dAhiNeNa'vi uttareNa'vi pamaddaM
jogaM joeMti, te NaM satta, taM jahA - 1. kattiyA, 2. rohiNI, 3. puNavvasU, 4.
mahA, 5. cittA, 6. visAhA, 7. aNurAhA,

Page #160 (AI-GENERATED, RESEARCH USE ONLY):
---------------------------
[109 4. Among those stars which are aligned with the south of the moon, there
are two Ashadhas which are aligned with the outer circle of the universe, or
will be aligned, or are going to be aligned. 5. Among those stars which are
aligned with the north of the moon, there is only one, Jyestha. The number of
lunar mansions, along with the Sun, Moon and stars, is 45. a. There are lunar
mansions which are not separated from the stars. b. There are lunar mansions
which are separated from the stars. c. There are lunar mansions which are the
combination of the Sun, Moon and stars. d. There are lunar mansions which are
separated from the Sun. p. a. Among these fifteen lunar mansions, which lunar
mansions are not separated from the stars? b. Which lunar mansions are separated
from the stars? c. Which lunar mansions are the combination of the Sun, Moon and
stars? d. Which lunar mansions are separated from the Sun? u. a. Among these
fifteen lunar mansions, 1. p. 1. There are, venerable sir, twenty-eight stars.
Which stars are aligned with the south of the moon? 2. Which stars are aligned
with the north of the moon? 3. Which stars are aligned with both the south and
north of the moon? 4. Which stars are aligned with the south of the moon? 5.
Which stars are aligned with the moon? 1. Gotama! There are, venerable sir,
twenty-eight stars. Among those stars which are aligned with the south of the
moon, there are six, namely: 1. Sthana, 2. Adda, 3. Pushya, 4. Ashlesha, 5.
Hasta, 6. Mula. These six stars are outside the outer circle of the universe. 2.
Among those stars which are aligned with the north of the moon, there are
twelve, namely: 1. Abhijit, 2. Savana, 3. Dhanishtha, 4. Shatabhisha, 5.
Purvabhadrapada, 6. Uttarabhadrapada, 7. Revati, 8. Ashvini, 9. Bharani, 10.
Purva Phalguni, 11. Uttara Phalguni, 12. Satabhisha. 3. Among those stars which
are aligned with both the south and north of the moon, there are seven, namely:
1. Krittika, 2. Rohini, 3. Punarvasu, 4. Magha, 5. Chitra, 6. Visakha, 7.
Anuradha. 4. Among those stars which are aligned with the south of the moon,
there are two Ashadhas which are aligned with the outer circle of the universe,
or will be aligned, or are going to be aligned. 5. Among those stars which are
aligned with the moon, there is only one, Jyestha. - Jambudvipa-Vyakhyana 7,
Sutra 157]

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

## 110  **a.**  Of those lunar mansions which are not devoid of stars, there are
eight: 1. The first lunar mansion, 2. The third lunar mansion, 3. The sixth
lunar mansion, 4. The seventh lunar mansion, 5. The eighth lunar mansion, 6. The
tenth lunar mansion, 7. The eleventh lunar mansion, 8. The thirteenth lunar
mansion.  **b.** Of those lunar mansions which are devoid of stars, there are
seven: 1. The second lunar mansion, 2. The fourth lunar mansion, 3. The fifth
lunar mansion, 4. The ninth lunar mansion, 5. The twelfth lunar mansion, 6. The
thirteenth lunar mansion, 7. The fourteenth lunar mansion.  **c.** Of those
lunar mansions which are the common abode of the Sun and Moon stars, there are
four: 1. The first lunar mansion, 2. The second lunar mansion, 3. The eleventh
lunar mansion, 4. The fifteenth lunar mansion.  **d.** Of those lunar mansions
which are devoid of the Sun stars, there are five: 1. The sixth lunar mansion,
2. The seventh lunar mansion, 3. The eighth lunar mansion, 4. The ninth lunar
mansion, 5. The tenth lunar mansion.

From the tenth Prabhruta [the twelfth Prabhruta-Prabhruta] onwards, the deities
of the Nakshatras are 46. How are the deities of these Nakshatras assigned?  So,
for the twenty-eight Nakshatras:  1. To which deity is the Abhijit Nakshatra
assigned? Ans: To Brahma Deva.  2. To which deity is the Savan Nakshatra
assigned? Ans: To Vishnu Deva.  3. To which deity is the Dhanishtha Nakshatra
assigned? Ans: To Vasu Deva.  4. To which deity is the Shatabhisha Nakshatra
assigned? Ans: To Varuna Deva.  5. To which deity is the Purva-Phalguni
Nakshatra assigned? Ans: To Aja Deva.  6. To which deity is the Uttara-Phalguni
Nakshatra assigned? Ans: To Ahi-Varddhi Deva.  7. To which deity is the Revati
Nakshatra assigned? Ans: To Pushya Deva.  8. To which deity is the Ashwini
Nakshatra assigned? Ans: To Ashva Deva.  9. To which deity is the Bharani
Nakshatra assigned? Ans: To Yama Deva.  10. To which deity is the Krittika
Nakshatra assigned? Ans: To Agni Deva.  1. Abhivriddhi, Angtra-Ahirbudhna etc.
2. Pousha-Poushanamka Deva, not Surya-paryaya, as Revati is known as Poushanam.
3. Ashva-namka Deva.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

## 112] [ Surya Prajnapti Sutra 11.P. To which Deva is the Rohini Nakshatra
assigned? _A. It is assigned to Payavaideva, 12.P. To which Deva is the Santhana
Nakshatra assigned? A. It is assigned to Soma Deva, 13.P. To which Deva is the
Adda Nakshatra assigned? A. It is assigned to Rudra Deva, 14.P. To which Deva is
the Punarvasu Nakshatra assigned? A. It is assigned to Aditi Deva, 15.P. To
which Deva is the Pusya Nakshatra assigned? A. It is assigned to Bahasai Deva,
16.P. To which Deva is the Ashlesha Nakshatra assigned? A. It is assigned to
Sappa Deva, 17.P. To which Deva is the Maha Nakshatra assigned? A. It is
assigned to Piti Deva, 18.P. To which Deva is the Purva Phalguni Nakshatra
assigned? A. It is assigned to Bhaga Deva, 19.P. To which Deva is the Uttara
Phalguni Nakshatra assigned? - A. It is assigned to Ajjama Deva, 20.P. To which
Deva is the Hasta Nakshatra assigned? A. It is assigned to Suviya Deva, 21.P. To
which Deva is the Chitra Nakshatra assigned? A. It is assigned to Tathe Deva,
22.P. To which Deva is the Swati Nakshatra assigned? A. It is assigned to Vau
Deva, 1. Prajapati is the Deva with the name Brahma, and he bears all the
synonyms of Brahma, hence the famous Brahma, etc. 2. Soma is the Moon, hence the
famous Saumya, Chandramas, etc. 3. Rudra is Shiva, hence the famous Raudra,
Kalini, etc. 4. Pitar is the name of a Deva, 5. Aryama is a specific Deva, 6.
Savita is the Sun, 7. Tvasta is a Deva with the name Tvastra, hence the famous
Tvastri, Chitra, etc.

Nakshatra assigned? A. To Indra, 24.Q. To which deity is the Anuradha Nakshatra
assigned? A. To Mitra, ......... 25.Q. To which deity is the Jyeshta Nakshatra

Visvedeva, 1. K - Visakha - Dvidaivatamiti prasiddham. 2. Nairritah -
Rakshasasten. 3. Apo - Jalanama devasten Purvashadha toyamiti prasiddham. 4.

nakkhatte kindevayae pannatte? A. Goma! Brahmadevaya pannatta, Gahao: 1. Brahma,

10. Agni, 11. Payavai, 12. Some, 13. Rudde, 14. Adi. 15. Bahassai, 16. Sappe,

Mitto, 25. Inde, 26. Nirai, 27. Au, 28. Vissa ya. Thus, the Nakshatras are
assigned to deities in a particular order, until the Uttarashadha Nakshatra. Q.
To which deity is the Uttarashadha Nakshatra assigned? A. Goma! To Visvedeva, -
Jambu. Vakkh. 7, Su. 158

## Names of Muhurtas - 47.  **K. P. Ta. Kaham te Muhurttaanaam Naamadhejjhaa?
Ahie tti Vaejjaa, U. Egamegassa Nam Ahoraattassa Tiisan Muhurtta Pannaatta
Tanjhaa Gahaao:**  1. Rodde, 2. Satte, 3. Mittae, 4. Vaa, 5. Supee, 6.
Abhichande, 7. Mahinde, 8. Palambe, 9. Bhambe, 10. Sacche, 11. Aanande, 12.
Vijaye, 13. Vissasene, 14. Paayaavacche, 15. Uvasame, 16. Isaane, 17. Tatthe,
18. Bhaaviyappa, 19. Vesamane, 20. Varune, 21. Satarise, 22. Gandhavve, 23.
AggiviSayaane, 24. Aatave, 25. Aate, 26. Tatthave, 27. Bhoome, 28. Risabhe, 29.
Savvatthasiiddhe, 30. Rakkhase.  **Gahaao:**  Dashamapraabhrut [Terahvaam
Praabhrutpraabhrut]  - Etaya - Brahma-Vishnu-Varunadhirpaya Paripaatyaa, Na Tu
Parateerthikaprayukta - Ashva-Yama-Dahan - Kamalajaadhirpaya Netavyaa Parisamadi
Praapaniya.  - 1. Bhamha, 2. Vindu, 3. Avasu, 4. Varune, 5. Ay, 6. Vuddhi, 7.
Paus, 8. Aas, 9. Jame, 10. Aggi, 11. Payaavai, 12. Some, 13. Rudde, 14. Aditi,
15. Bahassai, 16. Sappe, 17. Piu, 18. Bhag, 19. Ajjam, 20. Savia, 21. Tattha,
22. Vaa, 23. Taheva, Indaggi, 24. Mittae, 25. Inde, 26. Nirui, 27. Aath, 28.
Vissa Ya Boddhvave.  Jambhu. Vakkha. 47, Su. 174  Eka Hee Aagam Me Atthavaas
Nakshatra Devataao Ke Naamo Ki Gaathaae Bhinna-Bhinna Rachnaa Shaili Me Do Baar

Gyaan Ki Vruddi Ho.  1. Egamege Nam Ahoraatte Tiisan Muhurtte Muhurttgge Nam
Pannaatta, Easi Nam Tiisaae Muhurttaanaam Tiisan Naamadhejjhaa Pannaatta, Tam
Jhaa 1. Rodde, 2. Satte, 3. Mittae, 4. Vaa, 5. Supee, 6. Abhichande, 7. Mahinde,

## The Tenth Prabhruta [Fourteenth Prabhruta-Prabhruta]  **Question:** What are
the names of the 48 days?  **Answer:** There are 15 days in each fortnight,
named as follows:  * **Days:** 1. Padivaya, 2. Bitiya, 3. Taiya, 4. Chauthi, 5.
Panchmi, 6. Chhathi, 7. Sattami, 8. Athamo, 9. Navami, 10. Dasami, 11.
Ekkharasi, 12. Barasi, 13. Terasi, 14. Chaudas, 15. Pannares.  * **Names:** 1.
Puvange, 2. Siddhamanorame, 3. Y Tattho, 4. Manoharo Cheva, 5. Jasabhadde, 6.
Jasodhara, 7. Savvakamasamiddhe Ti Ya, 8. Inde Muddhabhisitte Ya, 9. Somanas,
10. Dhananjay, 11. Ya Boddhvave, 12. Aththasiddhe, 13. Abhijaye, 14. Accasana,
15. Satangaye, 16. Aggivise, 17. Uvasame.  **Question:** What are the names of
the 48 Raio?  **Answer:** There are 15 Raio in each fortnight, named as follows:
* **Raio:** 1. Padivaraai, 2. Bitiyaraai, 3. Tatiyaraai, 4. Chauthiraai, 5.
Panchmiraai, 6. Chhathiraai, 7. Satmiraai, 8. Athmiraai, 9. Navmiraai, 10.
Dasmiraai, 11. Ekkharasiraai, 12. Barasiraai, 13. Terasiraai, 14. Chaussiraai,
15. Pannaressiraai.  * **Names:** 1. Uttama Ya, 2. Sunakhatta, 3. Elavaccha, 4.
Jasodhara, 5. Somanas Cheva Taha, 6. Sirisambhuta Ya Boddhva, 7. Vijaya Ya, 8.
Vejayanti, 9. Jayanti, 10. Aparajia Ya, 11. Gachcha Ya, 12. Samahara Cheva Taha,
13. Te Ya Taha Ya, 14. Atitaya, 15. Devanandanirati.
