[118] [Surya Prajnapti Sutra] P. 11. In which gotra is the Rohini nakshatra
established? A. It is established in the Gotama gotra. P. 12. In which gotra is
the Santhana nakshatra established? A. It is established in the Bharadvaja
gotra. P. 13. In which gotra is the Adha nakshatra established? A. It is
established in the Lahicchaayana gotra. P. 14. In which gotra is the Punarvasu
nakshatra established? A. It is established in the Vasishtha gotra. P. 15. In
which gotra is the Pushya nakshatra established? A. It is established in the
Ujjayana gotra. P. 16. In which gotra is the Ashlesha nakshatra established? A.
It is established in the Mandavvaayana gotra. P. 17. In which gotra is the Magha
nakshatra established? A. It is established in the Pingayana gotra. P. 18. In
which gotra is the Purva Phalguni nakshatra established? A. It is established in
the Govallayana gotra. P. 19. In which gotra is the Uttara Phalguni nakshatra
established? A. It is established in the Kasava gotra. P. 20. In which gotra is
the Hasta nakshatra established? A. It is established in the Kosiya gotra. P.
21. In which gotra is the Chitra nakshatra established? A. It is established in
the Dabbiyaana gotra. P. 22. In which gotra is the Swati nakshatra established?
A. It is established in the Chamarachcha gotra. P. 23. In which gotra is the
Visakha nakshatra established? A. It is established in the Sungayana gotra. P.
24. In which gotra is the Anuradha nakshatra established? A. It is established
in the Golavvaayana gotra. P. 25. In which gotra is the Jyeshta nakshatra
established? A. It is established in the Tigicchaayana gotra.

**Nakshatra Food for Success**  **51. P.** **U.** **From the tenth [to the
seventeenth] Nakshatra**  **1.** **2.** **3.** **4.** **How are these foods?**
It is said that: **In the twenty-eighth Nakshatra:** * **Krittika:**  Success is
achieved by eating curd. * **Rohini:** Success is achieved by eating Vasa-mansa
(meat of a particular animal). * **Mrigashira:** Success is achieved by eating
deer meat. * **Aardra:** Success is achieved by eating salt. * **Punarvasu:**
Success is achieved by eating ghee. * **Pushya:** Success is achieved by
drinking milk. * **Ashlesha:** Success is achieved by eating Divaga-mansa (meat
of a particular animal). * **Magha:** Success is achieved by eating Kasoti (a
type of food). **5.** **6.** **7.** **8.** **9.** **Purva Phalguni:** Success is
achieved by eating frog meat. **10.** **Uttara Phalguni:** Success is achieved
by eating Nakhhi-mansa (meat of a particular animal). **11.** **Hasta:** Success
is achieved by eating Vatthani (a type of food). **12.** **Chitra:** Success is
achieved by eating Mugga Suvena (a type of food). **13.** **Swati:** Success is
achieved by eating fruits. **14.** **Visakha:** Success is achieved by eating
Asitti (a type of food). **15.** **Anuradha:** Success is achieved by eating
Misakur (a type of food). **16.** **Jyeshta:** Success is achieved by eating
Kolatti (a type of food). **17.** **Moola:** Success is achieved by eating
Mulapanna (a type of food). **18.** **Purva Ashadha:** Success is achieved by
eating Amalag-sarira (a type of food). **19.** **Uttara Ashadha:** Success is
achieved by eating Bille (a type of food). **1.** **Rohini:** Success is
achieved by eating Chamsa-mansa (a type of meat).  **A.S. Samiti published this
text on page 151 (with variations).**

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

## From the tenth Prabhruta to the seventeenth Prabhruta Prabhruta:  20. They
perform the Bhocca ceremony with flowers on the Abhijit Nakshatra. 21. They
perform the Bhocca ceremony with milk on the Savana Nakshatra. 22. They perform
the Bhocca ceremony with juice on the Dhanishta Nakshatra. 23. They perform the
Bhocca ceremony with Tuvari on the Satabhisha Nakshatra. 24. They perform the
Bhocca ceremony with the remains of the previous day's food on the Pushya
Nakshatra. 25. They perform the Bhocca ceremony with boar meat on the Uttara
Nakshatra. 26. They perform the Bhocca ceremony with aquatic animal meat on the
Revati Nakshatra. 27. They perform the Bhocca ceremony with bird meat or turtle
meat on the Asvini Nakshatra. 28. They perform the Bhocca ceremony with sesame
and rice on the Bharani Nakshatra.  1. Kulmasa, rice, Masha, cow's yogurt, ghee,
milk, buffalo meat, its blood, payasa, sesame, Marg, Shasha, sixty types of
Priyangu, puffed rice, and colored eggs are considered good fruits. || 84 ||
Karm, Sarika, Godhika, sesame, Shalya, Havishya, horse's ghee, Krisara, Mudga,
and ground barley are also considered good. || 85 || Fish, colored food, and
yogurt food are also considered good. Thus, a wise person should consider what
is edible and what is not edible and eat accordingly. || 85 ||  [ 121 - This
seventeenth Prabhruta Prabhruta in the Muhurta Chintamani, the chapter on
travel, is not actually taught by the Bhagavan, but seems to have been added by
someone else. This style of language is not found in the Bhagavan's teachings.
For example, in some places, the third case plural is used, such as "Kattiyahim,
Rohinihim, Addahim," while in other places, the third case singular is used,
such as "Punavvasuna, Pussehena, Addaae." Also, in the context of food, the
third case is used in some places, while the second case is used in others. For
example, "Dahina Bhocca, Baniyena Bhocca, Khirena Bhocca" uses the third case,
while "Vasabha Mansa Bhocca, Miga Mansa Bhocca, Deeva Mansa Bhocca" uses the
second case. This inconsistent use of language suggests that this section was
not taught by the Bhagavan.  Furthermore, in some places, the consumption of
land, water, and air animals is mentioned as a cause for success. This is
completely inappropriate, as the Bhagavan, who teaches the protection of the six
bodies and the six-bodied beings, would never advocate for the consumption of
meat. Such teachings are not found anywhere in the scriptures. Therefore, it is
certain that this section is not part of the Bhagavan's teachings.  However,
there is another logical reason. In the scriptures, the counting of the
Nakshatras always starts from the Abhijit Nakshatra, as it is the first
Nakshatra of the Yuga. In this scripture, the first Prabhruta Prabhruta of the
tenth Prabhruta begins with the following sutra:  "How do you know that the
objects are arranged in this way? What is the basis for this arrangement? They
said, "There are five different interpretations here. They said, "All the
Nakshatras, starting from Krittika and ending with Bharani, are one." || 1 ||
This is the first interpretation of the other Tirthankaras. They believe that
the Nakshatras, starting from Krittika and ending with Bharani, are one. There
are five such interpretations of the other Tirthankaras. The second
interpretation is: "All the Nakshatras, starting from Magha and ending with
Ashlesha, are one." || 2 ||  The third interpretation is: "All the Nakshatras,
starting from Dhanishta and ending with Shravana, are one." || 3 ||  The fourth
interpretation is: "All the Nakshatras, starting from Ashvini and ending with
Revati, are one." || 4 ||  The fifth interpretation is: "All the Nakshatras,
starting from Bharani and ending with Ashvini, are one." || 5 ||  After refuting
all these five interpretations, the Bhagavan presents his own view:

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================
 dazama prAbhRta- sattarahavA prAbhRtaprAbhRta ] 20. abhIyiNA pupphehiM bhoccA
kajjaM sAdheMti, 21. savaNeNaM khIreNaM bhoccA kajjaM sAdheMti, 22. dhaNiTThAhiM
jUseNaM bhocyA kajjaM sAdheMti, 23. satabhisayAe tuvarIo bhoccA kajjaM sAdheMti,
24. puvvAhiM puTThavayAhiM kArillaehiM bhocyA kajjaM sAdheMti, 25. uttarAhiM
puTThavayAhiM varAhamaMsaM bhoccA kajjaM sAdheMti, 26. revatIhiM jalayara-maMsaM
bhoccA kajjaM sAdheMti, 27. assiNIhiM titira-maMsaM vaTTakamaMsaM vA bhoccA
kajjaM sAdheMti, 28. bharaNIhiM talaM (tila) taMdulakaM bhocyA kajjaM sAdheMti
/  1. kulmASAMstilataNDulAnapi tathA mASAMzca gavyaM dadhi, tvAjyaM
dugdhamathaiNamAMsamaparaM tasyaiva raktaM tathA  /  tadvatpAyasameva

## The Tenth Prabhruta [Eighteenth Prabhruta-Prabhruta]  In one Yuga, the number
of solar and lunar cycles is 52. P.K. How are these cycles? Answer: There are
two types of cycles here, as follows: 1. Solar cycles, 2. Lunar cycles. P.K. How
are the lunar cycles? Answer: In a Yuga of five years,   1. The moon joins with
the Abhijit Nakshatra for 77 cycles, 2. The moon joins with the Savana Nakshatra
for 77 cycles, and so on, until 3-28. The moon joins with the Uttara Ashadha
Nakshatra for 77 cycles. P.K. How are the solar cycles? Answer: In a Yuga of
five years,   1. The sun joins with the Abhijit Nakshatra for five cycles, and
so on, until 2-28. The sun joins with the Uttara Ashadha Nakshatra for five
cycles.  "We say this - all the Nakshatras from Abhijit to Uttara Ashadha are
established, as follows: Abhijit, Savana, until Uttara Ashadha."  The commentary
by Malayagiri Suri on this is as follows:  The beginning of the Yuga starts on
the first day of the bright fortnight of Shravana month, when the moon joins
with the Abhijit Nakshatra at the time of the Balavakarna. This is stated in the
Jyotish Karndaka:  "On the first day of the bright fortnight of Shravana month,
the moon joins with the Abhijit Nakshatra."  "In all cases, the beginning of the
Yuga is considered to be the time of the moon's conjunction." This is stated by
Bharata, the great scholar. Thus, the Nakshatras from Abhijit onwards are
established, considering the moon's conjunction as the beginning of all specific
times.  Here, the Nakshatras from Krittika to Bharani are considered to be the
first by the early Tirthankaras. According to their view, this Prabhruta-
Prabhruta is seen. This is not the view of the Bhagavan, as it is clear that in
this seventeenth Prabhruta-Prabhruta, the Bhagavan's form cannot be established.
This is enough elaboration.  - Chandraprajnapti Prakashka Commentary

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

## Dashama Prabhruta [Nineteenth Prabhruta Prabhruta]  A year has 53 months. P.
How are those months? A. Thus it is said, U.  A year has twelve months, and they
are named in two ways, as follows: 1. Loiya, 2. Lo Uttariya.  The Loiya names
are: 1. Savane, 2. Bhaddave, 3. Asoe, 4. Kattie, 5. Maggasire, 6. Pose, 7. Mahe,
8. Phaggune, 9. Chette, 10. Vesah, 11. Jette, 12. Asadhe.  The Lo Uttariya names
are:  - 1. Abhinandane, 2. Supaithe, 3. Vijaye, 4. Piivaddhane, 5. Sejanse, 6.
Siviya, 7. Sisire, 8. Hemvan. ||1|| 9. Navame Vasanta Mase, 10. Dasame Kusuma
Sambhave, 11. Ekadasame Nidaho, 12. Vanavirohi ya Barase. ||2|| 1. Jambu. Vakkh.
7, Su. 153

##  Types of Years and Their Characteristics  **54.** **Q.** What are the types
of years? **A.** There are five types of years: 1. Nakshatra-Samvatsara, 2.
Yuga-Samvatsara, 3. Paman-Samvatsara, 4. Lakshan-Samvatsara, 5. Sanichchar-
Samvatsara.  **55.** **1. Nakshatra-Samvatsara:** **a.** There are twelve
Nakshatras in a Nakshatra-Samvatsara: 1. Savana, 2. Bhadrava, 3. Asouya, 4.
Kattika, 5. Maggasira, 6. Pousa, 7. Mahe, 8. Phagguniya, 9. Chitta, 10. Vaisaha,
11. Jetta, 12. Asadha. **b.** The entire Nakshatra Mandala is completed in
twelve years by the Bahussai Mahaggha.  **56.** **2. Yuga-Samvatsara:** **a.**
There are five types of Yuga-Samvatsara: 1. Chanda, 2. Chanda, 3. Abhivaddiya,
4. Chanda, 5. Abhivaddiya. **b.** The first Chanda-Samvatsara has 24 Pavas, the
second Chanda-Samvatsara has 24 Pavas, the Abhivaddiya-Samvatsara has 26 Pavas,
the fourth Chanda-Samvatsara has 24 Pavas, and the fifth Abhivaddiya-Samvatsara
has 26 Pavas. **c.** Thus, in a Yuga of five years, there are 124 Pavas in
total.  **57-58.** **3. Paman-Samvatsara:** **a.** There are five types of
Paman-Samvatsara: 1. Nakshatra, 2. Chanda, 3. Udu, 4. Aicha, 5. Abhivaddiya.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

[ 125 4. Lakshana Samvatsara's Characteristics - _In Lakshana Samvatsara, five
types are established, namely - 1. Nakshatra, 2. Chandra, 3. Udu, 4. Aiccha, 5.
Abhivaddhiya. 5. Sanichchara Samvatsara's Characteristics - In Sanichchara
Samvatsara, twenty-eight types are established, namely - 1. Abhiyi, 2. Savana,
3. Dhanishtha, 4. Satabhisaya, 5. Puvvapoṭṭavaya, 6. Uttarapoṭṭavaya, 7. Revati,
8. Assiṇi, 9. Bharani, 10. Kattiya, 11. Rohini, 12. Sanṭhaṇā, 13. Adda, 14.
Punavassu, 15. Pussa, 16. Asseṣa, 17. Maha, 18. Puvvafagguni, 19. Uttarafagguni,
20. Hatthe, 21. Chitta, 22. Sai, 23. Visaha, 24. Anuraha, 25. Jettha, 26. Mule,
27. Puvvasaḍha, 28. Uttarasadha. In Sanichchara, the entire Nakshatra Mandala is
completed in thirty years. Gatha - Nakshatra Samvatsara Lakshana - All
Nakshatras rise together, all Udu's culminate together. There is no absence,
Many Nakshatras rise. ||1|| Chandra Samvatsara Lakshana - The moon rises
together with the full moon, The Nakshatras rise in an uneven manner. There is
much rain, That is called Chandra Samvatsara. ||2|| 3. Udu (Karma) Samvatsara
Lakshana - The uneven ones culminate, The flowers and fruits are not ripe. The
season does not stay properly, That is called Karma Samvatsara. ||3|| Aiccha
Samvatsara Lakshana - It gives the taste of earth and water, And the flowers and
fruits in Aiccha. Even with little rain, The crops are fully ripened. ||4||
Abhivaddhiya Samvatsara Lakshana - The Aiccha's influence is seen, The moments,
seconds, and days culminate. It fills the earth with dust, That is called
Abhivaddhiya. ||5|| 1. Thaṇam. 5, U. 3, Su. 460 2. Thaṇam. 5, U. 3, Su. 460 ]

## Tenth Prabhruta [Twenty-first Prabhruta Prabhruta]  The direction of the
Nakshatras - 59. P. Ta, how is the direction of the Tejo?  Ahiye tti vaejja, U.
Tatha khalu imao panch padivattao pannattio, tanjaha -  There, they said - 1.
Ta, the seven Nakshatras starting from Katta are in the East direction, some
said. Some, however, said - 2. Ta, the seven Nakshatras starting from Maha are
in the East direction, some said. Some, however, said - 3. Ta, the seven
Nakshatras starting from Dhanishtha are in the East direction, some said. Some,
however, said - 4. Ta, the seven Nakshatras starting from Ashlesha are in the
East direction, some said. Some, however, said - 5. Ta, the seven Nakshatras
starting from Bharani are in the East direction, some said.  1. There, those who
said - (a) Ta, the seven Nakshatras starting from Katta are in the East
direction, they said, tanjaha - 1. Katta, 2. Rohini, 3. Mrigashirsha, 4. Ardra,
5. Punarvasu, 6. Pushya, 7. Ashlesha. (b) The seven Nakshatras starting from
Maha are in the South direction, tanjaha - 1. Maha, 2. Purva Phalguni, 3. Uttara
Phalguni, 4. Hasta, 5. Chitra, 6. Swati, 7. Visakha. (c) The seven Nakshatras
starting from Anuradha are in the West direction, tanjaha - 1. Anuradha, 2.
Jyeshta, 3. Mula, 4. Purva Ashadha, 5. Uttara Ashadha, 6. Abhijit, 7. Shravana.
(d) The seven Nakshatras starting from Dhanishtha are in the North direction,
tanjaha - 1. Dhanishtha, 2. Shatabhisha, 3. Purva Bhadrapada, 4. Uttara
Bhadrapada, 5. Revati, 6. Ashlesha,

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

[ 127 7. Bharani. 2. There, those who said this - (a) The seven constellations
starting with Maha are located in the east, they said, for example - 1. Maha, 2.
Purva Phalguni, 3. Uttara Phalguni, 4. Hasta, 5. Chitta, 6. Swati, 7. Visakha,
(b) The seven constellations starting with Anuradha are located in the south,
for example - 1. Anuradha, 2. Jyestha, 3. Mula, 4. Purva Ashadha, 5. Uttara
Ashadha, 6. Abhijit, 7. Sravana, (c) The seven constellations starting with
Dhanishtha are located in the west, for example - 1. Dhanishtha, 2. Shatabhisha,
3. Purva Bhadrapada, 4. Uttara Bhadrapada, 5. Revati, 6. Ashwini, 7. Bharani.
(d) The seven constellations starting with Krittika are located in the north,
for example - 1. Krittika, 2. Rohini, 3. Mrigashira, 4. Ardra, 5. Punarvasu, 6.
Pushya, 7. Aslesha. 3. There, those who said this - • (a) The seven
constellations starting with Dhanishtha are located in the east, they said, for
example - 1. Dhanishtha, 2. Shatabhisha, 3. Purva Bhadrapada, 4. Uttara
Bhadrapada, 5. Revati, 6. Ashwini, 7. Bharani. (b) The seven constellations
starting with Krittika are located in the south, for example - 1. Krittika, 2.
Rohini, 3. Mrigashira, 4. Ardra, 5. Punarvasu, 6. Pushya, 7. Aslesha. (c) The
seven constellations starting with Maha are located in the west, for example -
1. Maha, 2. Purva Phalguni, 3. Uttara Phalguni, 4. Hasta, 5. Chitta, 6. Swati,
7. Visakha, (d) The seven constellations starting with Anuradha are located in
the north, for example - 1. Anuradha, 2. Jyestha, 3. Mula, 4. Purva Ashadha, 5.
Uttara Ashadha, 6. Abhijit, 7. Sravana. 4. There, those who said this - (a) The
seven constellations starting with Ashwini are located in the east, they said,
for example - 1. Ashwini, 2. Bharani, 3. Krittika 4. Rohini, 5. Mrigashira, 6.
Ardra, 7. Punarvasu, 1. (a) The seven constellations starting with Krittika are
located in the east, (b) The seven constellations starting with Maha are located
in the south, (c) The seven constellations starting with Anuradha are located in
the west, (d) The seven constellations starting with Dhanishtha are located in
the north, - Sam. S. 7, Su. 8, 9, 10, 11, the sutras given here are indicative
of other beliefs, but there is no such sentence in these sutras that would allow
a common reader to know these sutras as other beliefs. Although the first
constellation in the Jain Agamas is Abhijit and the last constellation is Uttara
Ashadha, how is it possible to know the different orders of the different
constellations that changed at different times without studying the Agamas?

## 128] [ Surya Prajnapti Sutra (b) The seven Nakshatras starting with Pushya
are in the South direction, they are: 1. Pushya, 2. Ashlesha, 3. Magha, 4. Purva
Phalguni, 5. Uttara Phalguni, 6. Hasta, 7. Chitra. (c) The seven Nakshatras
starting with Satabhisha are in the West direction, they are: 1. Satabhisha, 2.
Visakha, 3. Anuradha, 4. Jyeshta, 5. Mula, 6. Purva Ashadha, 7. Uttara Ashadha.
(d) The seven Nakshatras starting with Abhijit are in the North direction, they
are: 1. Abhijit, 2. Swati, 3. Dhanishta, 4. Shatabhisha, 5. Purva Bhadrapada, 6.
Uttara Bhadrapada, 7. Revati. 5. There are some who say: (a) The seven
Nakshatras starting with Bharani are in the East direction, they are: 1.
Bharani, 2. Krittika, 3. Rohini, 4. Mrigashira, 5. Ardra, 6. Punarvasu, 7.
Pushya. (b) The seven Nakshatras starting with Ashlesha are in the South
direction, they are: 1. Ashlesha, 2. Magha, 3. Purva Phalguni, 4. Uttara
Phalguni, 5. Hasta, 6. Chitra, 7. Swati. (c) The seven Nakshatras starting with
Visakha are in the West direction, they are: 1. Visakha, 2. Anuradha, 3.
Jyeshta, 4. Mula, 5. Purva Ashadha, 6. Uttara Ashadha, 7. Abhijit. The seven
Nakshatras starting with Swati are in the North direction, they are: 1. Swati,
2. Dhanishta, 3. Shatabhisha, 4. Purva Bhadrapada, 5. Uttara Bhadrapada, 6.
Revati, 7. Ashwini. We, however, say: (a) The seven Nakshatras starting with
Abhijit are in the East direction, they are: 1. Abhijit, 2. Swati, 3. Dhanishta,
4. Shatabhisha, 5. Purva Bhadrapada, 6. Uttara Bhadrapada, 7. Revati. (b) The
seven Nakshatras starting with Ashwini are in the South direction, they are: 1.
Ashwini, 2. Bharani, 3. Krittika, 4. Rohini, 5. Mrigashira, 6. Ardra, 7.
Punarvasu.

## From the tenth Prabhruta [twenty-second Prabhruta-Prabhruta] ## Of the
Nakshatras, the Saruva-Paruva-na ## 60. P. So, how is that Nakshatra-vijaya?
Tell me. ## U. So, in Jambudvipa, in the island, of all the islands, of all the
seas, of all the oceans, of all the continents, of all the mountains, up to one
hundred thousand yojanas in length and breadth, three hundred thousand yojanas,
sixteen thousand, two hundred and twenty-seven hundred yojanas, three kosas,
twenty-eight dhanus, thirteen angulas, and a little more than half an angula, it
is declared by calculation. ― K. So, in Jambudvipa, in the island, Two Chandras,
1. Prabhasensu va, 2. Prabhasenti va, 3. Prabhasissanti va, Kh. Two Suryas, 1.
Tavinsu va, 2. Taventi va, 3. Tavissanti va, Thus, G. Fifty-six Nakshatras, 1.
Joensu va, 2. Joenti va, 3. Joissanti va, 1. Two Abhi, 2. Two Savana, 3. Two
Dhanitta, 4. Two Satabhisaya, 5. Two Puhva Potthavaya, 6. Uttara Potthavaya, 7.
Two Revai, 8. Two Assini, 9. Two Bharani, 10. Two Kattiya, 11. Two Rohini, 12.
Two Santhana, 13. Two Adda, 14. Two Punavassu, 15. Two Pussa, 16. Two Assesaao,
17. Two Mahaao, 18. Two Puhvafagguni, 19. Two Uttarafagguni, 20. Two Hattha, 21.
Two Chitta, 22. Two Sai, 23. Two Visaha, 24. Two Anurada, 25. Two Jettha, 26.
Two Mula, 27. Two Puhvasadha, 28. Two Uttarasaadha. So, these fifty-six
Nakshatras, K. There are Nakshatras which, in nine Muhurtas, twenty-seven and
seventy-six parts of a Muhurta, join with the Chandra. - Kh. There are
Nakshatras which, in fifteen Muhurtas, join with the Chandra. G. There are
Nakshatras which, in thirty Muhurtas, join with the Chandra. Gh. There are
Nakshatras which, in forty-five Muhurtas, join with the Chandra. P. K. So, these
fifty-six Nakshatras - - Which Nakshatras, in nine Muhurtas, twenty-seven and
seventy-six parts of a Muhurta, join with the Chandra?

##  [130] [Surya Prajnapti Sutra]  **b. Which constellations join with the moon
for fifteen muhurtas?** **c. Which constellations join with the moon for thirty
muhurtas?** **d. Which constellations join with the moon for forty-five
muhurtas?** **e. a. Thus, there are fifty-six constellations.** **Among them,
those constellations which join with the moon for nine muhurtas and twenty-seven
parts of a muhurta are two, b. Among them, those constellations which join with
the moon for fifteen muhurtas are twelve, such as:** 1. Two Satabhisha, 2. Two
Bharani, 3. Two Adda, 4. Two Assesa, 5. Two Sati, 6. Two Jyestha. **c. Among
them, those constellations which join with the moon for thirty muhurtas are
thirty, such as:** 1. Two Savana, 2. Two Dhanishtha, 3. Two Purvabhadrapada, 4.
Two Revati, 5. Two Asvini, 6. Two Krittika, 7. Two Santhana, 8. Two Pushya, 9.
Two Maha, 10. Two Purva Phalguni, 11. Two Hasta, 12. Two Chitra, 13. Two
Anuradha, 14. Two Mula, 15. Two Purvashadha. **d. Among them, those
constellations which join with the moon for forty-five muhurtas are twelve, such
as:** 1. Two Uttaraphalguni, 2. Two Rohini, 3. Two Punarvasu, 4. Two
Uttaraphalguni, 5. Two Visakha, 6. Two Uttarashadha. **a. Thus, there are fifty-
six constellations.** **There are constellations which join with the sun for
four days and six muhurtas, they are two, b. There are constellations which join
with the sun for six days and twenty-one muhurtas, c. There are constellations
which join with the sun for thirteen days and twelve muhurtas, d. There are
constellations which join with the sun for twenty days and three muhurtas, e. a.
Thus, there are constellations.** **Which constellations join with the sun for
four days and six muhurtas? b. Which constellations join with the sun for six
days and twenty-one muhurtas? c. Which constellations join with the sun for
thirteen days and twelve muhurtas? d. Which constellations join with the sun for
twenty days and three muhurtas? e. a. Thus, there are fifty-six
constellations.** **Among them, those constellations which join with the sun for
four days and six muhurtas are...**

[131 From the tenth Prabhruta to the twenty-second Prabhruta-Prabhruta] [131
There are two types of Nakshatras, those that are in conjunction with the Sun
for twenty-one Muhurtas in a day and night, and those that are in conjunction
with the Sun for twelve Muhurtas in thirteen days and nights. a. The Nakshatras
that are in conjunction with the Sun for twenty-one Muhurtas in a day and night
are twelve in number, namely: 1. Two Satabhisha, 2. Two Bharani, 3. Two Adda, 4.
Two Assesa, 5. Two Sati, 6. Two Jettha. b. The Nakshatras that are in
conjunction with the Sun for twelve Muhurtas in thirteen days and nights are
thirty in number, namely: 1. Two Savana, 2. Two Dhanishtha, 3. Two
Purvabhadrapada, 4. Two Revati, 5. Two Asvini, 6. Two Kattta, 7. Two Santhana,
8. Two Pushya, 9. Two Maha, 10. Two Purva Phalguni, 11. Two Hasta, 12. Two
Chitta, 13. Two Anuradha, 14. Two Mula, 15. Two Purvashadha. c. The Nakshatras
that are in conjunction with the Sun for three Muhurtas in twenty days and
nights are twelve in number, namely: 1. Two Uttaraphalguni, 2. Two Rohini, 3.
Two Punarvasu, 4. Two Uttaraphalguni, 5. Two Visakha, 6. Two Uttarashadha. The
boundary extent of the Nakshatra Mandala is 61. Q. How is this boundary extent?
Please tell me. A. a. There are Nakshatras whose boundary extent is 630, 76
parts out of 30 parts. b. There are Nakshatras whose boundary extent is 1076
parts out of 30 parts. c. There are Nakshatras whose boundary extent is 2076
parts out of 30 parts. d. There are Nakshatras whose boundary extent is 3076
parts out of 30 parts. Q. a. Which Nakshatras have a boundary extent of 630, 76
parts out of 30 parts? b. Which Nakshatras have a boundary extent of 1076 parts
out of 30 parts? c. Which Nakshatras have a boundary extent of 2076 parts out of
30 parts? d. Which Nakshatras have a boundary extent of 3076 parts out of 30
parts? A. a. The Nakshatras whose boundary extent is 630, 76 parts out of 30
parts are two in number.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================
 dazama prAbhRta - bAvIsavAM prAbhRtaprAbhRta ] [ 131 NaM do abhII, kha. tattha
je te NakkhattA, je NaM cha ahoratte egavIsaM ca muhutte sUreNa saddhiM jogaM
joeMti, te NaM bArasa taMjahA - 1. do satabhisayA, 2. do bharaNI, 3. do addA, 4.

2. do rohiNI, 3. do puNavassU, 4. do uttarAphagguNI, 5. do. visAhA, 6.do
uttraasaaddhaa| NakkhattamaMDalANaM sImAvikkhaMbho - 61. pa. tA kahaM te

atthi NakkhattA, jesi NaM cha sayA tIsA sattasaTThibhAga tIsai bhAgANaM
sImAvikkhaMbho, kha. atthi NakkhattA, jesi NaM sahassaM paMcottaraM

NakkhattA, jesi NaM tisahassaM paMcadasuttaraM sattasaTThibhAga tIsai bhAgANaM
sImAvikkhaMbho, pa. ka. tA eesiM NaM chappaNNAe NakkhattANaM - _ kayare
NakkhattA jesi NaM chasayA, tIsA sattasaTThibhAga tIsai bhAgANaM sImA-vikkhabho,
kha. kayare NakkhattA jesi NaM sahassaM, paMcottaraM sattasaTThibhAga tIsai
bhAgANaM sImA-vikkhabho, ga. kayare NakkhattA jesiNaM do sahassA dasuttarA
sattasaTThibhAga tIsai bhAgANaM sImA-vikkhabho, gha. kayare NakkhattA jesi NaM
tisahassaM paMcadasuttaraM sattasaTThibhAga tIsai bhAgANaM sImA vikkhabho, u.
ka. tA eesiNaM chappaNNAe NakkhattANaM - . tattha je te NakkhattA, jesi NaM cha
sayA tIsA sattasaTThibhAga tIsai bhAge NaM sImAvikkhaMbho, te NaM do abhiiii|

Page #183 (AI-GENERATED, RESEARCH USE ONLY):

##  [132] [ Surya Prajnapti Sutra ]  **b.**  Those stars, whose boundary
diameter is 76 parts and 30 parts of a thousand and five, are twelve in number,
namely: 1. Two Satabhisha, 2. Two Bharani, 3. Two Adda, 4. Two Assesa, 5. Two
Sati, 6. Two Jettha.  **c.** Those stars, whose boundary diameter is 76 parts
and 30 parts of two thousand and ten, are thirty in number, namely: 1. Two
Savana, 2. Two Dhanishtha, 3. Two Purvabhadrapada, 4. Two Revati, 5. Two Asvini,
6. Two Kattta, 7. Two Santhana, 8. Two Pushya, 9. Two Maha, 10. Two Purva
Phalguni, 11. Two Hasta, 12. Two Chitta, 13. Two Anuradha, 14. Two Mula, 15. Two
Purvashadha.  **d.** Those stars, whose boundary diameter is 76 parts and 30
parts of three thousand and fifteen, are twelve in number, namely: 1. Two
Uttarapotthapada, 2. Two Rohini, 3. Two Punarvasu, 4. Two Uttara Phalguni, 5.
Two Visakha, 6. Two Uttarashadha.  **The conjunction of the Moon with the stars
- 62.**  **p.** **k.**  In these fifty-six stars, which of them are in
conjunction with the Moon at the time of its rising?  **b.** In these fifty-six
stars, which of them are in conjunction with the Moon at the time of its
setting?  **c.** In these fifty-six stars, which of them are in conjunction with
the Moon when it enters and exits?  **u.** **k.** In these fifty-six stars, none
of them are in conjunction with the Moon at the time of its rising.  **b.** None
of them are in conjunction with the Moon at the time of its setting.  **c.**
None of them are in conjunction with the Moon when it enters and exits, because
there are two eclipses.  Therefore, these two eclipses occur thirty-four times
each, both during the new moon and the full moon.  **The conjunction of the Moon
with the full moon - 63.**  Therefore, these twenty-eight full moons and twenty-
eight new moons are established.  **1.** **p.** In these five years, on which
full moon does the Moon join the first star?  **u.** On the same full moon on
which the Moon joins the last star in the last of these twenty-eight full moons.
**1.** Therefore, from the position of the full moon, the last twenty-eighth
full moon, from the position of the end of the full moon, the circle is divided
by 124.

[133 The mandala should be divided into 32 parts by 24 hundred, 64 parts should
be considered for the first full moon, 2. Q. In which country does the moon
appear on the second full moon of these five years? A. In the country where the
moon appears on the first full moon, the mandala should be divided into 32 parts
by 24 hundred, 64 parts should be considered for the second full moon, 3. Q. In
which country does the moon appear on the third full moon of these five years?
A. In the country where the moon appears on the second full moon, the mandala
should be divided into 32 parts by 24 hundred, 64 parts should be considered for
the third full moon, 4. Q. In which country does the moon appear on the twelfth
full moon of these five years? A. In the country where the moon appears on the
third full moon, the mandala should be divided into 180 parts by 24 hundred, 64
parts should be considered for the twelfth full moon, thus, according to this
calculation, the mandala should be divided into 32 parts by 24 hundred, 64 parts
should be considered for each full moon in each country. 5. Q. In which country
does the moon appear on the last, 62nd full moon of these five years? A. In
Jambudvipa, the mandala should be divided into 27 parts by 24 hundred, 64 parts
should be considered for the southern quadrant, 18 parts should be considered
for the western quadrant, 20 parts should be considered for the northern
quadrant, and the remaining 3 parts and 2 kalas should be considered for the
eastern quadrant, the moon appears on the last, 62nd full moon in this region.
1. 'Two hundred and eighty parts' means, The twelfth full moon after the third
full moon is the ninth full moon, Then, by multiplying nine by ninety, two
hundred and eighty are obtained. 2. 1. 'Jambudvipa' etc. In the phrase
'Jambudvipa', the word 'dvipa' is used in the sense of 'island', and the word
'prachina' is used in the sense of 'ancient', and the word 'apachina' is used in
the sense of 'modern'. Therefore, the meaning is that the moon appears in the
north-east, south-west, north-south, east-west, and south-north directions, and
the mandala should be divided into 24 hundred parts, and then divided into four
parts, and then the southern quadrant should be divided into 27 parts, and then
the western quadrant should be divided into 18 parts, and then the northern
quadrant should be divided into 20 parts, and then the remaining 3 parts and 2
kalas should be considered for the eastern quadrant, and the moon appears on the
last, 62nd full moon in this region. - Commentary

##  [134] [Surya Prajnapti Sutra]  **1. Q:** In these five years, on which day
of the full moon does the sun enter the first constellation? **A:** The sun
enters the last constellation on the full moon day. From that full moon day, the
circle is divided into 240 parts, and the first constellation is 9/240 of the
circle. The sun enters the first constellation on that full moon day.  **2. Q:**
In these five years, on which day of the full moon does the sun enter the second
constellation? **A:** The sun enters the first constellation on the full moon
day. From that full moon day, the circle is divided into 240 parts, and the
second constellation is 9/240 of the circle. The sun enters the second
constellation on that full moon day.  **3. Q:** In these five years, on which
day of the full moon does the sun enter the third constellation? **A:** The sun
enters the second constellation on the full moon day. From that full moon day,
the circle is divided into 240 parts, and the third constellation is 9/240 of
the circle. The sun enters the third constellation on that full moon day.  **4.
Q:** In these five years, on which day of the full moon does the sun enter the
twelfth constellation? **A:** The sun enters the third constellation on the full
moon day. From that full moon day, the circle is divided into 240 parts, and the
twelfth constellation is 84/240 of the circle. The sun enters the twelfth
constellation on that full moon day.  Thus, in this way, from each full moon
day, the circle is divided into 240 parts, and the sun enters each constellation
on the corresponding full moon day.  **5. Q:** In these five years, on which day
of the full moon does the sun enter the last constellation? **A:** The sun
enters the last constellation on the full moon day. From that full moon day, the
circle is divided into 240 parts, and the last constellation is 27/240 of the
circle.  **1. '84/240'** The twelfth full moon is nine days after the third full
moon. Then, 9 is multiplied by 9, resulting in 84.  **2.** The last full moon of
the western era is the 62nd full moon. From that point, the circle is divided
into 240 parts. The sun enters each constellation after 9/240 of the circle.
Then, 9 is multiplied by 62, resulting in 558. Then, 558 is divided by 240,
resulting in 2.325. This means that the sun completes 2 full circles and enters
the 33rd constellation.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |

[ 135 Twenty-eight parts are to be divided by twenty-six, eighteen parts are to
be divided by eighteen, in these parts, two are to be divided by two. The
southern quadrant of the mandala is not complete. Here, the sun is seen on the
last full moon day. The moon is seen on the new moon day. 65. P. So, on which
day of the year will the new moon be seen in which country? A. In the country
where the moon is seen on the last full moon day, the mandala of the new moon
day is to be divided by twenty-four, thirty-two parts are to be divided by
thirty-two. Here, the moon will be seen on the first new moon day. Similarly, as
the full moon days are named, so are the new moon days, such as - second, third,
twelfth. So, in this way, the mandala of the new moon day is to be divided by
twenty-four, thirty-two parts are to be divided by thirty-two. In those
countries, the new moon will be seen on that day. P. So, on which day of the
year will the last new moon be seen in which country? A. In the country where
the moon is seen on the last full moon day, the mandala of the full moon day is
to be divided by twenty-four, sixteen parts are to be divided by sixteen. Here,
the moon will be seen on the last new moon day. The sun is seen on the new moon
day. P. So, on which day of the year will the first new moon be seen in which
country? A. In the country where the sun is seen on the last new moon day, the
mandala of the new moon day is to be divided by twenty-four, forty-nine parts
are to be divided by forty-nine. Here, the sun will be seen on the first new
moon day. Similarly, as the full moon days of the sun are named, so are the new
moon days. 1. 'Evamityadi' In this way, as the full moon days of the moon are
named, so are the new moon days, such as - second, third, twelfth. P. So, on
which day of the year will the second new moon be seen in which country? A. In
the country where the moon is seen on the first new moon day, the mandala of the
new moon day is to be divided by twenty-four, thirty-two parts are to be divided
by thirty-two. Here, the moon will be seen on the second new moon day. P. So, on
which day of the year will the third new moon be seen in which country? A. In
the country where the moon is seen on the second new moon day, the mandala of
the new moon day is to be divided by twenty-four, thirty-two parts are to be
divided by thirty-two. Here, the moon will be seen on the third new moon day. P.
So, on which day of the year will the twelfth new moon be seen in which country?
A. In the country where the moon is seen on the new moon day, the mandala of the
new moon day is to be divided by twenty-four, two hundred and eighty-eight parts
are to be divided by two hundred and eighty-eight. Here, the moon will be seen
on the twelfth new moon day.

 dazama prAbhRta - bAvIsavAM prAbhRtaprAbhRta ] [ 135 aTThAvIsaibhAgaM vIsahA
chettA aTThArasabhAge uvAiNAvettA tihiM bhAgehiM dohi ya kalAhiM dAhiNillaM
caubbhAgamaMDalaM asaMpatte ettha NaM sUrie carimaM bAvar3ei puNNimAsiNiM joei|
caMdasya amAvAsAsu jogo 65. pa. tA eesiNaM paMcaNhaM saMvacchArANaM paDhamaM

battIsaM bhAge uvAiNAvettA ettha NaM se caMde paDhama amAvAsaM joei, evaM jeNeva

NaM desaMsi sUre carimaM bAvaTuiM amAvAsaM joei, tAe amAvAsasaMThANAe maMDalaM
cauvvIseNaM saeNaM chettA cauNauibhAge uvAiNAvettA, ettha NaM se sUre paDhamaM
amAvAsaM joei, evaM jeNeva abhilAveNaM sUriyassa puNNimAsiNIo teNeva abhilAveNaM
amAvAsAo 1. 'evamityAdi' evamuktaprakAreNa yenaivAbhilApena candrasya
paurNamAsyo bhaNitAstenaivAbhiAlApenAmAvAsyA api bhaNitavyAH, tadyathA -
dvitIyA, tRtIyA, dvAdazI ca taashcaivm| pa. tA eesi NaM paMcaNhaM saMvaccharANaM
doccaM amAvAsaM caMde kaMsi desIma joei? u. tA jasi NaM desaMsi caMde paDhamaM
amAmAsaM joei, tAo NaM amAvAsaTANAo maMDalaM cauvIseNaM saeNaM chettA, battIsaM
bhAge uvAiNAvettA, ettha NaM se caMde docca amAvAsaM joei, pa. tA eesiNaM
paMcaNhaM saMvaccharANaM taccaM amAvAsaM caMde kaMsi desaMmi joei? u. tA jasi
NaM desaMsi caMde doccaM amAvAsaM joei, tAo amAvAsaTThANAo maMDalaM cauvIseNaM
saeNaM chettA, battIsaM bhAge uvAiNAvettA, ettha NaM se caMde taccaM amAvAsaM
joei, pa. tA eesi NaM paMcaNhaM saMvaccharANaM duvAlasamaM amAvAsaM caMde kaMsi
desaMmi joei ?  /  u. tA jasi NaM desaMsi caMde amAvAsaM joei, tAo NaM

[136] [Surya Prajnapti Sutra] * Niyavvaos, tanjaha - biiya, taiya, duvalasami.
Ekhalu aenan uvaenan taae taae amaavasatthanaae mandalam cauvviseṇam saenaṁ
chetta, ca uṇauīṁ cauṇauī bhāge uvaināvetta, tansi tansi desansi taṁ taṁ
amaavasaṁ sūrie joed. P. Ta aesiṇam pañcaṇhaṁ samvaccharāṇam carimāṁ bāvaṭṭhi
amaavasaṁ sūre kansi desansi joei? U. Ta jansi ṇam desansi sūre carimāṁ bāvaṣṭuṁ
amaavasaṁ joei, taae puṇṇimāsiṇīṭhaṇāae . mandalam cauvvise ṇam saenaṁ chetta
sattālīsaṁ bhāge osakkāvaitta, ettha ṇam sūrie carimāṁ bāvaṭuṁ amaamāsaṁ joei.
Puṇṇimāsiṇisu candass ya sūrass ya ṇakkhaṭṭāṇam jōgō 67. 1. K. P. Ta aesiṇam
pañcaṇhaṁ samvaccharāṇam paḍhama puṇṇimāsiṇi cande keṇam ṇakkhate joei? U. Ta
ḍhaṇiṭṭāhiṁ, ḍhaṇiṭṭhāṇam tiṇṇi muhuttā egūṇavīsaṁ ca bāvaṭṭhibhāgā muhuttass
bāvaṭṭhibhāgaṁ ca sattaṭṭhidhā chetta paṇṇatṭi cuṇṇiyā bhāgā sesā. Kh. P. Taṁ
samayaṁ ca ṇam sūrie keṇam ṇakkhateṇam joei? U. Ta puvvafaggūṇīhiṁ, puvvafaggūṇī
aṭṭhāvīsaṁ muhuttā aṭṭhatīsaṁ ca bāvaṭṭhibhāgā muhuttass bāvaṭṭhibhāgaṁ ca
sattaṭṭhidhā chetta battisaṁ cuṇṇiyā bhāgāsesā, 2. K. P. Ta aesiṇam pañcaṇhaṁ
samvaccharāṇam doccaṁ puṇṇimāsiṇiṁ cande keṇam ṇakkhate joei? U. Ta uttarāhiṁ
poṭṭavayāhiṁ, uttarāṇam poṭṭhavayāṇam sattāvīsaṁ muhuttā coddas ya bāvaṭṭhibhāgā
muhuttass bāvaṭṭhibhāgaṁ ca sattaṭṭidhā chetta bāvaṭuṁ cuṇṇiyā bhāgāsesā. Kh. P.
Taṁ samayaṁ ca ṇam sūrie keṇam ṇakkhateṇam joei?  _ U. Ta uttarāhiṁ faggūṇīhiṁ,
uttarāfuggūṇīṇam sattamuhuttā tetisaṁ ca bāvaṭṭhibhāgā muhuttass 1. 'Evamityādi'
evamuktena prākāreṇa temaivaabhilāpena sūryasya paurṇamāsya
uktāstenaivābhilāpenaamāvāsyā api vaktavyaḥ, tadyathā  _- dvitīyā, tṛtīyā,
dvādaśī ca tāścaivam. P. Aesi ṇam pañcaṇhaṁ samvaccharāṇam doccaṁ amaavasaṁ sūre
kansi desansi joei? U. Ta jasiṇam desansi sūre paḍhamaṁ amaavasaṁ joei, taao
amaavasatthanaao mandalam cauvīseṇam saenaṁ chetta, cauṇauī bhāge uvaināvetta,
ettha ṇam sūre doccaṁ amaavasaṁ joei, P. Ta aesiṇam pañcaṇhaṁ samvaccharāṇam
taccaṁ amaavasaṁ sūre kansi desansi joei? U. Ta jasi ṇam desansi docca amaavasaṁ
joei, taao amaavasatthanaao mandalam cauvīseṇam saenaṁ chetta, cauṇauī bhāge
uvaināvetta, ettha ṇam sūre taccaṁ amaavasa joei, P. Ta aesiṇam pañcaṇhaṁ
samvaccharāṇam duvalasamaṁ sūre kansi desansi joei? U. Ta jansi ṇam desansi sūre
taccaṁ amaavasaṁ joei, taao amaavasatthanaao mandalam cauvīseṇam saenaṁ chetta,
aṭṭha chhattale aṭṭhāsie bhāgasae uvaināvetta, ettha ṇam se sare duvalasamaṁ
amaavasaṁ joei.

[ 137 The 26th part is divided into 70, the remaining 21 parts are the fine
parts. 3. Q. P. On the 5th year, on which constellation does the moon fall on
the full moon day? A. On Asvini, on Asvini, 21 Muhurtas and 9 parts of the
Muhurta, the 26th part is divided into 70, the remaining fine parts. Q. P. On
which constellation does the sun fall at that time? A. On Chitra, on Chitra, 1
Muhurta and 28 parts of the Muhurta, the 26th part is divided into 70, the
remaining 30 fine parts. 4. Q. P. On the 5th year, on which constellation does
the moon fall on the 12th full moon day? A. On Uttara, on Ashadha, on Uttara and
Ashadha, 26 Muhurtas and 26 parts of the Muhurta, the 26th part is divided into
70, the remaining 44 fine parts. Q. P. On which constellation does the sun fall
at that time? A. On Punarvasu, on Punarvasu, 16 Muhurtas and 8 parts of the
Muhurta, the 26th part is divided into 70, the remaining 20 fine parts. 5. Q. P.
On the 5th year, on which constellation does the moon fall on the last full moon
day? A. On Uttara, on Ashadha, on Uttara and Ashadha, at the last time. Q. P. On
which constellation does the sun fall at that time? A. On Pushya, on Pushya, 19
Muhurtas and 43 parts of the Muhurta, the 26th part is divided into 70, the
remaining 33 fine parts. The conjunction of the moon, sun and constellations on
the new moon day 68. 1. Q. P. On the 5th year, on which constellation does the
moon fall on the first new moon day? A. On Aslesha, on Aslesha, 1 Muhurta and 44
parts of the Muhurta, the 26th part is divided into 70, the remaining 26 fine
parts. Q. P. On which constellation does the sun fall at that time? A. On
Aslesha, on Aslesha, 1 Muhurta and 44 parts of the Muhurta, the 26th part is
divided into 70, the remaining 26 fine parts. 2. Q. P. On the 5th year, on which
constellation does the moon fall on the second new moon day? A. On Uttara, on
Falgun, on Uttara and Falgun, 40 Muhurtas and 35 parts of the Muhurta, the 26th
part is divided into 70, the remaining 15 fine parts. Q. P. On which
constellation does the sun fall at that time?

##  [138] [Surya Prajnapti Sutra]  **U.**  What is the conjunction of the moon
with the asterism Uttara Phalguni in the Uttara Phalguni month? **A.**  It is
the same as the conjunction of the moon with the asterism Uttara Phalguni.
**K.P.**  What is the conjunction of the moon with the asterism Uttara Phalguni
on the 5th amavasya of the year? **U.**  It is 4 muhurtas and 10/60th of a
muhurta after the asterism Uttara Phalguni.  **K.P.**  What is the conjunction
of the sun with the asterism Uttara Phalguni at that time? **U.**  It is the
same as the conjunction of the moon with the asterism Uttara Phalguni.  **K.P.**
What is the conjunction of the moon with the asterism Uttara Phalguni on the
12th amavasya of the year? **U.**  It is 4 muhurtas and 10/60th of a muhurta
before the asterism Uttara Phalguni.  **K.P.**  What is the conjunction of the
sun with the asterism Uttara Phalguni at that time? **U.**  It is the same as
the conjunction of the moon with the asterism Uttara Phalguni.  **K.P.**  What
is the conjunction of the moon with the asterism Uttara Phalguni on the last
amavasya of the year? **U.**  It is 22 muhurtas and 42/60th of a muhurta after
the asterism Punarvasu.  **K.P.**  What is the conjunction of the sun with the
asterism Uttara Phalguni at that time? **U.**  It is the same as the conjunction
of the moon with the asterism Uttara Phalguni.  **K.P.**  What is the time
difference between the conjunction of the moon and the sun with the asterisms?
**U.**  The time difference between the conjunction of the moon and the sun with
the asterisms is 69.  **K.P.**  If the conjunction of the moon with an asterism
is observed in one place, what is the time difference for the conjunction of the
moon with the same asterism in another place? **U.**  If the conjunction of the
moon with an asterism is observed in one place, the time difference for the
conjunction of the moon with the same asterism in another place is 18 muhurtas
and 24/60th of a muhurta.  **K.P.**  If the conjunction of the moon with an
asterism is observed in one place, what is the time difference for the
conjunction of the moon with the same asterism in another place? **U.**  If the
conjunction of the moon with an asterism is observed in one place, the time
difference for the conjunction of the moon with the same asterism in another
place is 16 muhurtas and 44/60th of a muhurta.  **K.P.**  If the conjunction of
the moon with an asterism is observed in one place, what is the time difference
for the conjunction of the moon with the same asterism in another place? **U.**
If the conjunction of the moon with an asterism is observed in one place, the
time difference for the conjunction of the moon with the same asterism in
another place is 4000 muhurtas and 9 muhurtas.  **K.P.**  If the conjunction of
the moon with an asterism is observed in one place, what is the time difference
for the conjunction of the moon with the same asterism in another place? **U.**
If the conjunction of the moon with an asterism is observed in one place, the
time difference for the conjunction of the moon with the same asterism in
another place is 1009 muhurtas and 8 muhurtas.

Page #190 (AI-GENERATED, RESEARCH USE ONLY):

10th Prabhrita - Twenty-second Prabhrita  2. a. By which constellation the sun
is conjoined, in that region he takes up the three sets of thirty-six lunar
days. Then again, he is conjoined by another similar constellation in that
region.  b. By which constellation the sun is conjoined, in that region he takes
up the thirty-seven sets of lunar days. Then again, he is conjoined by another
similar constellation in that region.  c. By which constellation the sun is
conjoined, in that region he takes up the eighteen sets of thirty-one lunar
days. Then again, he is conjoined by the same constellation in that region.  d.
By which constellation the sun is conjoined, in that region he takes up the
thirty-six sets of sixty lunar days. Then again, he is conjoined by the same
constellation in that region.  70. The attainment of the course of the moon,
sun, planets, and constellations. When this moon attains the course, then the
other moons also attain the course. When the other moons attain the course, then
this moon also attains the course. When this sun attains the course, then the
other suns also attain the course. When the other suns attain the course, then
this sun also attains the course. Similarly for the planets and constellations.
The conjunction of the moon, sun, planets, and constellations. When this moon is
conjoined in the conjunction, then the other moons also are conjoined in the
conjunction. When the other moons are conjoined in the conjunction, then this
moon also is conjoined in the conjunction. Similarly for the sun, planets, and
constellations. Some moons are conjoined in the conjunctions, some suns are
conjoined in the conjunctions, some planets are conjoined in the conjunctions,
some constellations are conjoined in the conjunctions, both the moons are
conjoined in the conjunctions,

| Romanization (original text) |
======================
 dazama prAbhRta - bAvIsavAM prAbhRtaprAbhRta ] [ 139 2. ka. tA jeNaM aja

NakkhattANaM gaisamAvaNNattaM 70. tA jayA NaM ime caMde gaisamAvaNNae bhavai,
tayA NaM iyare'vi caMde gaisamAvaNNae bhvi| jayA NaM iyare caMde gaisamAvaNNae
bhavai, tayA NaM ime'vi caMde gaisamAvaNNae bhvi| tA jayA NaM ime sUrie
gaisamAvaNNae bhavai, tayA NaM iyare'vi sUrie gaisamAvaNNae bhvi| tA jayA NaM
iyare sUrie gaisamAvaNNae bhavai, tayA NaM ime'vi sUrie gaisamAvaNNae bhvi| evaM
gahe vi, Nakkhatte vi| caMda-sUra-gaha NakkhattANaM jogo tA jayA NaM ime caMde
jutte joge NaM bhavai, tayA NaM iyarevi caMde jutte joge NaM bhvi| tA jayA NaM
iyare caMde jutte joge NaM bhavai, tayA NaM ime'vi caMde jutte joge NaM bhvi|
evaM sUre'vi gahe'vi nnkkhtte'vi| sayA vi caMdA juttA jogehiM, sayA vi sUrA
juttA jogehiM, sayA vi gahA juttA jogehiM, sayA viNakkhattA juttA jogehi,
duhao'vi caMdA juttA jogehiM,

Page #191 (AI-GENERATED, RESEARCH USE ONLY):
---------------------------
[140] [ Surya Prajnapti Sutra ] The Sun is connected by yogas, the planets are
connected by yogas, the stars are connected by yogas, the mandala is divided
into 108,000 parts by 27 nakshatras, this is the division of the sky, the
victory of the nakshatras, thus I say.

## Eleventh Prabhruta  **Five years, the beginning of the Paryushana period, and
the time of the conjunction of the moon, sun, and constellations - 71. K.1. P.
How are these years, etc.?**  **A. It is said,**  **U. There are five years
designated here, as follows:**  1. Canda 2. Canda 3. Abhivaddiya 4. Canda 5.
Abhivaddiya  **The first Canda year - K.1. P. What is the beginning of the first
Canda year in these five years?**  **A. It is said,**  **U. The beginning of the
first Canda year is at the Paryushana of the fifth Abhivaddiya year, and the
time is after that.**  **G. P. What is the Paryushana?**  **A. It is said,**
**U. The Paryushana of the first Canda year is at the beginning of the second
Canda year, and the time is after that.**  **Gh. P. What constellation is the
moon in at that time?**  **U. It is in Uttara Ashadha, 26 Muhurtas of Uttara
Ashadha, 62 parts of a Muhurta, 77 parts of a part of a Muhurta, and 44 parts of
a part of a part of a Muhurta remaining.**  **P. What constellation is the sun
in at that time?**  **U. It is in Punarvasu, 16 Muhurtas of Punarvasu, 8 parts
of a Muhurta, 72 parts of a part of a Muhurta, and 20 parts of a part of a part
of a Muhurta remaining.**  **The second Canda year - K.2. P. What is the
beginning of the second Canda year in these five years?**  **A. It is said,**
**U. The beginning of the second Canda year is at the Paryushana of the first
Canda year, and the time is after that.**  **Kh. P. What is the Paryushana?**
**A. It is said,**

| Romanization (original text) |

[142] [Surya Prajnapti Sutra] U. So, what is the beginning of the *Abhivaddhiya*
year?   P.  At the end of the *Dvoccha* lunar year, the next moment is the
beginning of the *Abhivaddhiya* year. U.  At that time, what constellation is
the moon in? P.  In the *Purva Ashadha*, seven *muhurtas* of the *Purva
Ashadha*, 26 parts of the *muhurta*, 70 parts of the *bhaga*, 39 parts of the
*churniya* are remaining. U.  At that time, what constellation is the sun in? P.
In the *Punarvasu*, 42 *muhurtas* of the *Punarvasu*, 35 parts of the *muhurta*,
60 parts of the *bhaga*, 7 parts of the *churniya* are remaining. K.  What is
the beginning of the third *Abhivaddhiya* year? P.  So, what is the beginning of
the third *Abhivaddhiya* year in the five years? U.  At the end of the *Dvoccha*
lunar year, the next moment is the beginning of the third *Abhivaddhiya* year.
K.  What is the beginning of the third *Abhivaddhiya* year? U.  At the beginning
of the fourth lunar year, the next moment is the end of the third *Abhivaddhiya*
year. P.  At that time, what constellation is the moon in? U.  In the *Uttara
Ashadha*, 13 *muhurtas* of the *Uttara Ashadha*, 26 parts of the *muhurta*, 70
parts of the *bhaga*, 27 parts of the *churniya* are remaining. U.  At that
time, what constellation is the sun in? P.  In the *Punarvasu*, 2 *muhurtas* of
the *Punarvasu*, 56 parts of the *muhurta*, 60 parts of the *bhaga*, 60 parts of
the *churniya* are remaining. K.  What is the beginning of the fourth lunar
year? P.  So, what is the beginning of the fourth lunar year in the five years?
U.  At the end of the third *Abhivaddhiya* year, the next moment is the
beginning of the fourth lunar year. K.  What is the beginning of the fourth
lunar year? U.  At the beginning of the last *Abhivaddhiya* year, the next
moment is the end of the fourth lunar year. P.  At that time, what constellation
is the moon in? 4

## Eleventh Prabhruta  [143]  **Q:** On what day and time does the eleventh
Prabhruta begin?  **A:** It begins on the Uttara Ashadha, forty-four Muhurtas
after the beginning of Uttara Ashadha. Forty-four Muhurtas are equal to sixty-
four parts of a Muhurta, and sixty-four parts are equal to seventy-two parts of
a Muhurta. The remaining parts are forty-four.  **Q:** At that time, in which
Nakshatra is the Sun?  **A:** At that time, the Sun is in Punarvasu. The Sun is
twenty-nine Muhurtas and twenty-one parts of a Muhurta into Punarvasu. Twenty-
one parts of a Muhurta are equal to seventy-two parts of a Muhurta. The
remaining parts are fifty-three.  **Q:** What is the beginning of the fifth
Abhivaddhiya year?  **A:** Please tell me.  **A:** The beginning of the fifth
Abhivaddhiya year is the end of the fourth Chandra year.  **Q:** When is the end
of the fourth Chandra year?  **A:** Please tell me.  **A:** The end of the
fourth Chandra year is the beginning of the first year.  **Q:** At that time, in
which Nakshatra is the Moon?  **A:** At that time, the Moon is in Uttara
Ashadha, at the end of Uttara Ashadha.  **Q:** At that time, in which Nakshatra
is the Sun?  **A:** At that time, the Sun is in Pushya. The Sun is twenty-one
Muhurtas and forty-three parts of a Muhurta into Pushya. Forty-three parts of a
Muhurta are equal to seventy-two parts of a Muhurta. The remaining parts are
thirty-three.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

## Twelfth Prabhrit  **Five Years, Months and Muhurta Measurement** - 72. K.1.
P. How many years are there? Tell me. **A.** There are five years mentioned
here, namely: 1. Nakshatra, 2. Chandra, 3. Udu, 4. Aicha, 5. Abhivaddhia.
**First Nakshatra Year** - K. P. How many Muhurtas are there in the first
Nakshatra year, in the Nakshatra month, with 30 Muhurtas per day? Tell me.
**A.** There are 27 Raindhiyas and 21/60th of a Raindhiya, tell me. G. P. How
many Muhurtas are there? Tell me. **A.** There are 821 Muhurtas and 27/60th of a
Muhurta, tell me. Gh. P. This is half of the 12-Nakshatra year, how many
Raindhiyas are there? Tell me. **A.** There are 327 Raindhiyas and 51/60th of a
Raindhiya, tell me. Ng. P. How many Muhurtas are there? Tell me. **A.** There
are 9832 Muhurtas and 56/60th of a Muhurta, tell me.  **Second Chandra Year** -
2. K. P. How many Raindhiyas are there in the second Chandra year, in the
Chandra month, with 30 Muhurtas per day? Tell me. **A.** There are 39 Raindhiyas
and 32/60th of a Raindhiya, tell me.

| Romanization (original text) |
======================

## Twelfth Prabhrit  **1. ** **Q.** How many Muhurta-Ggas are there in a
Chandrasamvatsara? **A.** There are 850 Muhurtas and 36 parts of a Muhurta in a
Chandrasamvatsara.  **2.** **Q.** How many Raindhiya-Ggas are there in half of a
Chandrasamvatsara (12 Muhurta-Kadas)? **A.** There are 372 Raindhiyas and 12
parts of a Raindhiya in half of a Chandrasamvatsara.  **3.** **Q.** How many
Muhurta-Ggas are there in half of a Chandrasamvatsara (12 Muhurta-Kadas)? **A.**
There are 10,069 Muhurtas and 25 parts of a Muhurta in half of a
Chandrasamvatsara.  **Second Udusamvatsara (3)**  **1.** **Q.** If there are 15
years and the Udusamvatsara has 30 Muhurtas in its Udumas, how many Raindhiya-
Ggas are there in 30 Muhurtas? **A.** There are 30 Raindhiyas in 30 Muhurtas.
**2.** **Q.** How many Muhurta-Ggas are there in 30 Muhurtas? **A.** There are
900 Muhurta-Ggas in 30 Muhurtas.  **3.** **Q.** How many Raindhiya-Ggas are
there in half of an Udusamvatsara (12 Muhurta-Kadas)? **A.** There are 306
Raindhiyas in half of an Udusamvatsara.  **4.** **Q.** How many Muhurta-Ggas are
there in half of an Udusamvatsara (12 Muhurta-Kadas)? **A.** There are 10,080
Muhurta-Ggas in half of an Udusamvatsara.  **Third Aicchasamvatsara (4)**
**1.** **Q.** If there are 15 years and the Aicchasamvatsara has 30 Muhurtas in
its Aicchamas, how many Raindhiya-Ggas are there in 30 Muhurtas? **A.** There
are 30 Raindhiyas and half a part of a Raindhiya in 30 Muhurtas.  **2.** **Q.**
How many Muhurta-Ggas are there in 30 Muhurtas? **A.** There are 915 Muhurta-
Ggas in 30 Muhurtas.  **3.** **Q.** How many Raindhiya-Ggas are there in half of
an Aicchasamvatsara (12 Muhurta-Kadas)? **A.** There are 306 Raindhiyas in half
of an Aicchasamvatsara.  **4.** **Q.** How many Muhurta-Ggas are there in half
of an Aicchasamvatsara (12 Muhurta-Kadas)? **A.** There are 10,090 Muhurta-Ggas
in half of an Aicchasamvatsara.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

dasamuhuttassa sahassAI Nava asIe muhuttasae muhuttagge NaM, Ahie tti vejjaa|

##  [Surya Prajnapti Sutra]  **146]**  **5. a.  ** If a *Abhivaddiya* year is
five years, then how many *Raindhiya* units are there in the fifth *Abhivaddiya*
year?  **Answer:** There are thirty-nine *Raindhiya* units and thirty-three
*Muhurta* units, seventeen sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit.  **b. ** How many
*Muhurta* units are there in the fifth *Abhivaddiya* year? **Answer:** There are
nine hundred and ninety-seven *Muhurta* units, seventeen sixtyths of a *Muhurta*
unit.  **c. ** If half of a *Dvaadasa Khutta Kada* is an *Abhivaddiya* year,
then how many *Raindhiya* units are there in it? **Answer:** There are three
hundred and thirty-three *Raindhiya* units and thirty-one *Muhurta* units,
eighteen sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit.  **d. ** How many *Muhurta* units are
there in half of a *Dvaadasa Khutta Kada*? **Answer:** There are eleven thousand
and fifty-five *Muhurta* units, eighteen sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit.  **73. a.
** How many *Raindhiya* units are there in nine *Yuga*s? **Answer:** There are
seventeen thousand and eighty-nine *Raindhiya* units, nineteen *Muhurta* units,
forty-seven sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit, and seventy-six sixtyths of a
*Muhurta* unit, which is equal to one and sixteen sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit.
**b. ** How many *Muhurta* units are there in nine *Yuga*s? **Answer:** There
are seventy-nine thousand and forty-nine *Muhurta* units, forty-seven sixtyths
of a *Muhurta* unit, and seventy-six sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit, which is
equal to one and sixteen sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit.  **c. ** How many
*Raindhiya* units are there in a *Jagapatti*? **Answer:** There are thirty-eight
*Raindhiya* units, ten *Muhurta* units, four sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit, and
seventy-six sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit, which is equal to one and sixteen
sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit.  **d. ** How many *Muhurta* units are there in a
*Jagapatti*? **Answer:** There are eleven thousand and forty-five *Muhurta*
units, four sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit, and seventy-six sixtyths of a
*Muhurta* unit, which is equal to one and sixteen sixtyths of a *Muhurta* unit.
**e. ** How many *Raindhiya* units are there in a *Yuga*? **Answer:** There are
eighteen thousand and thirty-three *Raindhiya* units.

## Twelfth Prabhrit  **C. Q. How many Muhurtas are there in a year?** **A. There
are 44,000 Muhurtas, 900 Muhurtas, and some Muhurtas, in a year.**  **The
completion of the Parambha-Pajjavasa period of five years** **147**  **C. Q. How
many 60th parts of a Muhurta are there in a year?** **A. There are 34,000, 28,
and 60th parts of a Muhurta in a year.**  **74. 1. K. Q. How many solar and
lunar years are there in a Samadi Samapajjavasi?** **A. There are 60 solar
months and 62 lunar months.**  **These are half of 12 Khuttakadas, 12 times 30
solar years, and 31 lunar years.** **Therefore, there are 30 solar years and 31
lunar years in a Samadi Samapajjavasi.**  **Kh. Q. How many solar, Udu, lunar,
and Nakshatra years are there in a Samadi Samapajjavasi?** **A. There are 60
solar months, 61 Udu months, 62 lunar months, and 70 Nakshatra months.**
**These are half of 12 Khuttakadas, 12 times 60 solar years, 61 Udu years, 62
lunar years, and 70 Nakshatra years.** **Therefore, there are 60 solar years, 61
Udu years, 62 lunar years, and 70 Nakshatra years in a Samadi Samapajjavasi.**
**G. Q. How many Abhivaddiya solar, Udu, lunar, and Nakshatra years are there in
a Samadi Samapajjavasi?** **A. There are 77 months, 7 days, 11 Muhurtas, 20 60th
parts of a Muhurta in an Abhivaddiya month, 60 solar months, 61 Udu months, 62
lunar months, and 70 Nakshatra months.**  **These are half of 56 Khuttakadas, 12
times 744 Abhivaddiya years, 780 solar years, 791 Udu years, 876 lunar years,
and 1088 Nakshatra years.** **Therefore, there are 744 Abhivaddiya years, 780
solar years, 791 Udu years, 876 lunar years, and 1088 Nakshatra years in a
Samadi Samapajjavasi.**

| Romanization (original text) |

## English Translation:  **148]** **1.**  "What is the duration of a
*rainditya*?" **2.**  "It is said that in a lunar year, three *chaupaṇṇa*
*rainditya*s, twelve and sixty-four parts of a *rainditya*, constitute a
*rainditya*." **3.**  "It is said that in a lunar year, three *chaupaṇṇa*
*rainditya*s, five *muhūrta*s, fifty and sixty-four parts of a *muhūrta*,
constitute a *rainditya*."  **75.** **[Sūryaprajñaptisūtra]** **1.**  "There are
six seasons, namely: 1. *Pāusa*, 2. *Varisārātta*, 3. *Sarata*, 4. *Hemānta*, 5.
*Vasānta*, 6. *Gimha*." **2.**  "All these six seasons, two months each, are
calculated by the *chaupaṇṇa* *chaupaṇṇa* *āyāṇa* and are said to be sixty-one
*rainditya*s in a *rainditya*."  **3.**  "There are six *avam* *aitiratta*s,
namely: 1. *Taiya* *pavva*, 2. *Sattama* *pavva*, 3. *Ekkārasa* *pavva*, 4.
*Paṇṇarasa* *pavva*, 5. *Egūṇavīsai* *pavva*, 6. *Tevisai* *pavva*."  **4.**
"There are six *atiratta*s, namely: 1. *Chauttha* *pavva*, 2. *Aṭṭhama* *pavva*,
3. *Bārasa* *pavva*, 4. *Solasama* *pavva*, 5. *Vīsai* *pavva*, 6. *Chauvīsai*
*pavva*."  **5.**  **Gāhā** "Six are *aitiratta*s, they are the days of humans.
Six are *avam* *aitiratta*s, they are the days of the moon."  **76.** **1.**
"There are five *vāsikki*s and five *hemānta* *auṭṭi*s." **2.**  "In a period of
five years, on which *nakkhatta* does the first *vāsikki* *auṭṭi* occur?" **3.**
"It occurs on the *nakkhatta* *Abhijinā* *Abhijinā*." **4.**  "On which
*nakkhatta* does the sun occur at that time?" **5.**  "It occurs on the
*nakkhatta* *Pūsa*, nineteen *muhūrta*s and forty-two parts of a *muhūrta*, two
parts of a *muhūrta*, seven parts of a *cheṭṭā*, thirty-three parts of a
*cuṇṇiya*." **6.**  "In a period of five years, on which *nakkhatta* does the
second *vāsikki* *auṭṭi* occur?"  **Notes:**  * **rainditya:** A unit of time
used in Jain cosmology. * **chaupaṇṇa:** A unit of time equal to 72 *muhūrta*s.
* **muhūrta:** A unit of time equal to 48 minutes. * **āyāṇa:** A unit of time
equal to 30 days. * **avam:** A lunar day that is shorter than a solar day. *
**aitiratta:** A lunar day that is longer than a solar day. * **pavva:** A lunar
day. * **vāsikki:** A type of lunar eclipse. * **auṭṭi:** A type of lunar
eclipse. * **nakkhatta:** A lunar mansion. * **cheṭṭā:** A unit of time equal to
1/12 of a *muhūrta*. * **cuṇṇiya:** A unit of time equal to 1/144 of a
*muhūrta*.

## Twelfth Prabhrit  **1.** **Q.** In what constellation does the moon rise at
the beginning of the first Hemanti-Avatti of the five-year cycle? **A.** In
Hathi, the fifth muhurta of Hathi, with fifty bavatthi-bhagas of the muhurta,
and seventy-seven chunniya-bhagas remaining after dividing the bavatthi-bhagas
by seventy-two. **Q.** In what constellation does the sun rise at that time?
**A.** In Uttara Ashadha, at the end of Uttara Ashadha.  **2.** **Q.** In what
constellation does the moon rise at the beginning of the second Hemanti-Avatti
of the five-year cycle? **A.** In Satabhisha, the second muhurta of Satabhisha,
with twenty-eight bavatthi-bhagas of the muhurta, and forty-three chunniya-
bhagas remaining after dividing the bavatthi-bhagas by seventy-two. **Q.** In
what constellation does the sun rise at that time? **A.** In Uttara Ashadha, at
the end of Uttara Ashadha.  **3.** **Q.** In what constellation does the moon
rise at the beginning of the first Vasikkin of the five-year cycle? **A.** In
Visakha, the thirteenth muhurta of Visakha, with forty-four bavatthi-bhagas of
the muhurta, and forty-four chunniya-bhagas remaining after dividing the
bavatthi-bhagas by seventy-two. **Q.** In what constellation does the sun rise
at that time? **A.** In Pushya, at the beginning of Pushya.  **4.** **Q.** In
what constellation does the moon rise at the beginning of the fourth Vasikkin of
the five-year cycle? **A.** In Revati, the nineteenth muhurta of Revati, with
thirty-two bavatthi-bhagas of the muhurta, and thirty-six chunniya-bhagas
remaining after dividing the bavatthi-bhagas by seventy-two. **Q.** In what
constellation does the sun rise at that time? **A.** In Pushya, at the beginning
of Pushya.  **5.** **Q.** In what constellation does the moon rise at the
beginning of the fifth Vasikkin of the five-year cycle? **A.** In Purva
Phalguni, the twelfth muhurta of Purva Phalguni, with forty-seven bavatthi-
bhagas of the muhurta, and thirteen chunniya-bhagas remaining after dividing the
bavatthi-bhagas by seventy-two. **Q.** In what constellation does the sun rise
at that time? **A.** In Pushya, at the beginning of Pushya.  **6.** **Q.** In
what constellation does the moon rise at the beginning of the first Avatti of
the five-year cycle? **A.** In Santhana, the eleventh muhurta of Santhana, with
thirty-nine bavatthi-bhagas of the muhurta, and seventy-seven chunniya-bhagas
remaining after dividing the bavatthi-bhagas by seventy-two. **Q.** In what
constellation does the sun rise at that time? **A.** In Pushya, at the beginning
of Pushya.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

## 150] [Surya Prajnapti Sutra] 3. a. P. What is the 5th Hemanti Utt (lunar
eclipse) in a cycle of 5 years, on which Nakshatra (constellation) does the Moon
fall? U. On Pushya, 19 Muhurtas (time units) of Pushya, 43 Bavatthi Bhaga (sub-
units of Muhurta), 72 Chettha (sub-units of Bavatthi Bhaga), 33 Chunniya Bhaga
(sub-units of Chettha) remaining. b. P. On which Nakshatra does the Sun fall at
that time? U. On Uttara Ashadha, at the end of Uttara Ashadha. 4. a. P. What is
the 4th Hemanti Utt in a cycle of 5 years, on which Nakshatra does the Moon
fall? U. On Mula, 6 Muhurtas of Mula, 48 Bavatthi Bhaga, 70 Chettha, 20 Chunniya
Bhaga remaining. b. P. On which Nakshatra does the Sun fall at that time? U. On
Uttara Ashadha, at the end of Uttara Ashadha. 5. a. P. What is the 5th Hemanti
Utt in a cycle of 5 years, on which Nakshatra does the Moon fall? U. On
Krittika, 18 Muhurtas of Krittika, 36 Bavatthi Bhaga, 70 Chettha, 0 Chunniya
Bhaga remaining. b. P. On which Nakshatra does the Sun fall at that time? U. On
Uttara Ashadha, at the end of Uttara Ashadha. The Moon's conjunction with the
Sun, and the conjunction's duration, 78. There are 10 types of conjunctions, as
follows: 1. Vasbhanu Joge, 2. Venuyanu Joge, 3. Manche Joge, 4. Manchai Manche
Joge, 5. Chhatte Joge, 6. Chhattai Chhatte Joge, 7. Jaanaddhe Joge, 8.
Ghansammadde Joge, 9. Pinie Joge, 10. Mandukaputte Joge. 1. P. What is the
Chhattai Chhatte Joge (conjunction) of the Moon in a cycle of 5 years, in which
country does it occur? U. In Jambudvipa, in the Paiin-Padini Ayyaya, Udin-Dahin
Ayyaya, the Jeeva Mandala (sphere of life) is divided into 24 parts, in the
southern-eastern quadrant, 27 parts are to be counted, 28 parts are to be
counted, 18 parts are to be counted, in these 3 parts, 2 Kala (sub-units of
parts), the southern-eastern quadrant is incomplete, here the Chhattai Chhatte
Joge of the Moon occurs. The Moon rises, is in the middle of the Nakshatra, and
sets. 2. P. On which Nakshatra does the Moon fall at that time? U. On Chitra, at
the end of Chitra.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

## Thirteenth Praabhrut  **B.** **79. Q.** How is the moon's increase and
decrease? Please explain. **A.**  It is 75 muhurtas and 30 bavatthi bhagas of a
muhurta.  **Q.** How is the moon's increase and decrease in the dark fortnight?
**A.** In the dark fortnight, the moon increases for 412 muhurtas and 36
bavatthi bhagas of a muhurta. For example, in the first day, the first part
increases, in the second day, the second part increases, and so on, until the
15th day, the 15th part increases. At the end, the moon becomes full. In the
remaining time, the moon becomes both full and waning. This is called Amavasya.
Similarly, in the first fortnight, on Amavasya, the dark fortnight begins. In
the dark fortnight, the moon increases for 412 muhurtas and 36 bavatthi bhagas
of a muhurta. For example, in the first day, the first part increases, in the
second day, the second part increases, and so on, until the 15th day, the 15th
part increases. At the end, the moon becomes waning. In the remaining time, the
moon becomes both full and waning. This is called Purnima.  Similarly, in the
second fortnight, it is Purnima.  **80. Q.** How many Purnimas and Amavasyas are
there in one Yuga? **A.** There are 48 Purnimas and 48 Amavasyas. There are 48
Kasina ragas, 48 Kasina viragas, 24 fortnights, and 24 Kasina raga-viraga
fortnights. In 5 years, there are 24 such fortnights.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

[152] [ Surya Prajnapti Sutra ] It is said that there are countless days,
passions, and dispassions in this world.  On the new moon, there are 480
muhurtas and 36 parts of a muhurta.  On the full moon, there are 480 muhurtas
and 36 parts of a muhurta.  On the new moon, there are 85 muhurtas and 30 parts
of a muhurta.  On the full moon, there are 85 muhurtas and 30 parts of a
muhurta.  This is the case in a lunar month. This is the case in all the yugas.
The moon travels 81 mandalas in half a lunar month.  Q. How many mandalas does
the moon travel in half a lunar month?  A. The moon travels 14 and 1/24th
mandalas in half a lunar month.  Q. How many mandalas does the moon travel in
half a solar month?  A. The moon travels 16 mandalas in half a solar month.  The
moon travels 16 mandalas, and there are two exceptional movements of the moon.
Q. What are the two exceptional movements of the moon?  A. The two exceptional
movements of the moon are: 1. When the moon is leaving the new moon, 2. When the
moon is entering the full moon.  These are the two exceptional movements of the
moon.  In the first lunar month, When the moon enters the southern part of the
sky in the first lunar month, it travels 7 and 1/2 mandalas.

| Romanization (original text) |

## Thirteenth Prabhruta  [153]  When the Moon enters the right side, it moves
through four (quarters).  P. Which are those four quarters through which the
Moon moves when it enters the right side in seven half-mandalas?  U. These are
the seven half-mandalas through which the Moon moves when it enters the right
side:  1. Second half-mandala 2. Fourth half-mandala 3. Sixth half-mandala 4.
Eighth half-mandala 5. Tenth half-mandala 6. Twelfth half-mandala 7. Fourteenth
half-mandala  These are the seven half-mandalas through which the Moon moves
when it enters the right side.  When the Moon enters the north side in the first
Ayan, it moves through six half-mandalas and thirteen and seventy-six parts of a
half-mandala.  When the Moon enters the north side, it moves through four
(quarters).  P. Which are those four quarters through which the Moon moves when
it enters the north side in six half-mandalas and thirteen and seventy-six parts
of a half-mandala?  U. These are the six half-mandalas and thirteen and seventy-
six parts of a half-mandala through which the Moon moves when it enters the
north side:  1. Third half-mandala 2. Fifth half-mandala 3. Seventh half-mandala
4. Ninth half-mandala 5. Eleventh half-mandala 6. Thirteenth half-mandala and
thirteen and seventy-six parts of the fifteenth mandala.  These are the six
half-mandalas and thirteen and seventy-six parts of a half-mandala through which
the Moon moves when it enters the north side.  Thus, the first Chandrayan is
completed.  In the second Chandrayan...  Neither in the half-month of the
Nakshatra nor in the half-month of the Moon,  Neither in the half-month of the
Moon nor in the half-month of the Nakshatra,

[154] [Surya Prajnapti Sutra] Q. What is the path of the moon in half a lunar
month? A. It travels half a circle, 77 parts of half a circle, 31 parts and 9
parts. When the moon exits from the last part of the Uttarayana, it travels 7
parts and 4 parts of the other's circle, 7 parts and 13 parts of its own circle.
When the moon exits from the last part of the Dakshinayana, it travels 6 parts
and 4 parts of the other's circle, 6 parts and 13 parts of its own circle. The
remaining 2 parts and 13 parts of the moon travel in an unusual way, self-
illuminated. Q. How do these 2 parts and 13 parts of the moon travel in an
unusual way, self-illuminated? A. These 2 parts and 13 parts of the moon travel
in an unusual way, self-illuminated, in two ways: 1. Within the entire circle,
2. Outside the entire circle. These 2 parts and 13 parts of the moon travel in
an unusual way, self-illuminated, in these two ways. This completes the
explanation of the Uttarayana and Dakshinayana of the moon. In a lunar month,
there is no solar month, In a solar month, there is no lunar month. Q. What is
the path of the moon in half a lunar month? A. It travels two half circles, 8
parts and 77 parts of half a circle, 77 parts and 31 parts and 18 parts. When
the moon enters from the last part of the Dakshinayana, it travels 11 parts and
77 parts of its own circle, and 13 parts and 77 parts of the other's circle.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

ciNNaM paDicarai,

Page #206 (AI-GENERATED, RESEARCH USE ONLY):
---------------------------
[The Thirteenth Prabhrta]  The moon traverses thirteen and sixty-seven parts of
its own and the other's course. This makes up the complete half-circle of the
outer (eastern) side. When the moon enters the eastern part, it traverses forty-
eight and sixty-seven parts of the outer eastern half-circle, thirteen and
sixty-seven parts of the other's course, and thirteen and sixty-seven parts of
its own course. This completes the outer eastern half-circle.   When the moon
enters the western part, it traverses eighty-seven and sixty-seven parts of the
fourth western half-circle, and subtracting sixty-seven parts, it traverses
eighteen parts of its own and the other's course. This completes the fourth
western half-circle.  Thus, the moon in one month traverses thirteen and forty-
four parts of the other's course, thirteen and thirteen parts of its own course,
two and forty-one parts, eighty-seven and sixty-seven parts, subtracting sixty-
seven parts, it traverses eighteen parts of its own and the other's course. The
remaining two and thirteen parts, which the moon traverses by itself without any
association, constitute its wandering course.  This is the moon, the moon, the
auspicious, the moon, the moon.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================

## Fourteenth Prabhruta  **The Many Causes of Darkness and Sin**  **A.**  1.
**Question:** What are the many causes of sin? **Answer:** The many causes of
sin are on the side of sin. 2. **Question:** How are the many causes of sin on
the side of sin? **Answer:** The many causes of sin are on the side of darkness.
3. **Question:** How are the many causes of sin on the side of darkness?
**Answer:** When the moon is waning, there are 48 muhutas and 64 parts of a
muhuta, and the moon is waning in those 64 parts. For example, the first part is
waning in the first part, the second part is waning in the second part, and so
on until the 15th part is waning in the 15th part. Thus, the many causes of sin
are on the side of darkness. 4. **Question:** How many are the many causes of
sin? **Answer:** They are countless.  **B.**  1. **Question:** What are the many
causes of darkness? **Answer:** The many causes of darkness are on the side of
darkness. 2. **Question:** How are the many causes of darkness on the side of
darkness? **Answer:** The many causes of darkness are on the side of sin. 3.
**Question:** How are the many causes of darkness on the side of sin?
**Answer:** When the moon is waning, there are 48 muhutas and 64 parts of a
muhuta, and the moon is waning in those 64 parts. For example, the first part is
waning in the first part, the second part is waning in the second part, and so
on until the 15th part is waning in the 15th part. Thus, the many causes of
darkness are on the side of sin. 4. **Question:** How many are the many causes
of darkness? **Answer:** They are countless.  **Note:** The meaning of Sutra 79
in the Surya Prajnapti Prabhruta 13 and Sutra 82 in the Surya Prajnapti
Prabhruta 14 is the same. The only difference is that Sutra 79 speaks of the
"decrease and increase of the moon," while Sutra 82 speaks of the "increase of
moonlight and darkness." However, the decrease and increase of the moon leads to
the increase of moonlight and darkness.

======================
| Romanization (original text) |
======================
 caudahavAM prAbhRta dosiNA aMdhayArassa ya bahuttakAraNaM 82. ka. 1. pa. tA
katA te dosiNA bahU AhiteMti vadejjA ? u. tA dosiNApakkhe NaM dosiNA bahU
Ahiteti vadejjA  /  2. pa. tA kahaM te dosiNApakkhe dosiNA bahU Ahiteti vadejjA
? u. tA aMdhakArapakkhAo NaM dosiNA bahU Ahiteti vadejjA  /  3. pa. tA kahaM te
aMdhakArapakkhAo NaM dosiNApakkakhe dosiNA bahU Ahiteti vadejjA ? u. tA
aMdhakArapakkhAoM NaM dosiNApakkhaM ayamANe caMde cattAri bAyAle muhuttasate
chattAlIsa ca bAvaTTibhAge muhuttassa jAI caMde virajjati, taMjahA paDhamAe
paDhamaM bhAgaM bidiyAe bidiyaM bhAgaM jAva paNNarasIe paNNarasaM bhAga  /  eMva
khalu aMdhakArapakkhAo NaM dosiNApakkakhe dosiNA bahU AhitAti vadejjA  /  4. pa.
